description: Heavy woven furnishing fabric with vertically symmetrical pattern with a large flowering tree supporting two fantastic beasts; a peacock and a dragon. Trimmed on three sides with a heavy plied cord.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands), ca. 1725
description:
Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description:
Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Woven Portrait, The Late Earl of Beaconsfield
description: Woven portrait of Prime Minister Benjamin Disraeli, the Earl of Beaconsfield.

title: Table Lamp Table Lamp
media: mold-blown soda glass, brass, copper, wood (base), metal, wire
description: Stem with cut brass and copper leaves supporting a brass ring with striated opalescent newel post form glass globe over bulb; raised on a wood base with electrification.

title: Print, Plate 7 (recto) and plate 8 (verso), Description of the Celebrations Given by the City of Strasbourg, from the series Fêtes de Strasbourg
description:
Plate 7 (recto) within rocaille border topped with coat of arms of France: 25 lines of text, “le quel il y avoit encore vingt autres Officiers des Principaux de la Tribu… diers avoient des bonnets de peau d’Ours à fonds de drapmaron galonnés..”

Plate 8 (verso) within rocaille border topped with coat of arms of France: 25 lines of text, “sur les coutures et terminés par une houppe soye et argent sur le devant… Le 5. Octobre jour de l’arrivée du Roi sur les dix heures du matin, M…”

title: Screen (USA)
description: Three vertically rectangular panels of marbleized glass, each panel framed with narrow copper edging oxidized to green and orange-red tones with two small ball feet at each end. The panels are hinged together by means of wire at juncture of feet and screen. Cut out copper overlay.  Glass marbleized in tones of red, green and amber with cut out overlay in “Spider web” pattern.

title: Book Illustration, Le nouveau jardin (The new garden), Pavillon et Tonnelle (pavilion and pergola)

Book Illustration, Diversi maniere d'adornare i cammini: ed ogni altra parte degli edifizj desunte dall'architettura Egizia, Etrusca, e Greca . . . Divers manners of ornamenting chimneys and all other parts of houses taken from the Egyptian, Tuscan and Grecian architecture . . ., Fireplace design, plate 27

Book Illustration, Note pour MM. les presidents et membres du jury international concernant l'etablissement de Jules Desfossé, fabricant de papiers peints, à Paris (Note to Messrs. the chairmen and members of the international jury for the establishment of Jules Desfossé, manufacturer of wallpaper, to Paris), Floral wallpaper design sample, plate 3
Print (Netherlands)
media: etching and engraving on white laid paper
description: Above, a panel decorated with a curved frame and rinceaux; below, a panel decorated with a central roundel and curved framing; corners made up of flowers.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Alpenkönig (King of the Alps)
media: brush and gouache, graphite on paper
description: Stylized interlacing swags with branches growing from curled sections in light blue brown and green on white background.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Archibald
description: Diamond pattern in blue, yellow, and white.

title: Textile (Germany)
description: Strip of white linen embroidered in white linen in design of conventionalized flowers and leaves with scrolls.

title: Print, Tiger's Dance (Tora-Odori), No. 48
description: A large iris, outer perianth leaves in mottled light blue and violet tints; inner leaves light blue.

title: Drawing, Wall Elevation
media: pen and black ink, brush and blue and yellow washes on wove paper
description: Side wall with paneled door center, marble pilasters either side, window far right, statue in a niche at left.

title: Sidewall, The Months
description: Children's paper from the original roll of Kate Greenaway paper depicting the twelve months of the year. Groups of two or three figures (mostly children) are arranged at random. The name of the month represented appears beneath each group. Apple blossoms and leaves tied with pink ribbon surround the various motifs. Being intaglio printed with oil colors would allow this paper to be wiped clean. Printed in blue, green, pink, yellow-brown and lavender on cream ground.

title: Print, New York Charities - St. Barnabas House, 304 Mulberry Street
media: wood engraving printed in black ink on paper
description: Horizontal rectangle containting four vignettes: Upper left shows two young women, with one knocking at door marked: "St. Barnabas"; upper center shows a woman wearing a cap and apron, and holding a key, framed by a doorway; upper right shows three women; and the lower shows a room with young women seated in groups, some about a center table.

title: Drawing, Sketch, Landscape
media: black crayon on paper; verso: black crayon, pen and ink, brush and bistre wash
description: Vertical rectangle. Two trees stand in the left foreground. At right is a view of hills across a lake. Verso: a nude woman crowed by a wreath with cloth draped across her lap is shown seated in the woods. Framing black lines.

title: Print, Le Vase Brisé (The Broken Vase)
description: Interior scene with a figure of a woman wearing house dress with white apron standing with hands up. At right, a white cat stands atop table; broken vase sits on the floor lower center.

title: Object ID #18803979
description: Leaf-shaped blade, almost straight edges, plain bolster. Silver ferrule with horizontal bands. Tapering white porcelain handle with dark blue floral and scrolled decoration. Silver button cap at the top of the handle.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Scenic, Psyche Bringing Venus a Goblet of Water from the Fountain of Youth
description: One scene from the twelve which illustrate the story of Cupid and Psyche. This scene, containing three panels, shows a kneeling Psyche offering a goblet to a seated Venus. Cupid, leaning on his bow, stands on a pedestal in the background. The figures are within an Empire-style interior, with marble-tiled walls, columns, fountains, coffered ceiling and parquet floor. The entire scene is printed in grisaille, or shades of gray.

title: Book Illustration, A Treatise of Japaning and Varnishing, Japanese village
Print, Virgin and Child in the Clouds
description: The Virgin is seated on a cloud, facing the spectator. She holds the Child in Her arms, His head resting on Her right arm. A head is seen upside down near the Virgin's left knee, indicating where a different design had been begun and abandoned. Signed in clouds, near lower center: "Rembrandt f. 1641."

title: Print, St. Cecilia
description: The saint is seated before a music-desk, singing; she is accompanied at the organ by an angel. A yong man enters the room in the left rear. Over it is an inscription tablet: "PRECATIO D. CAECILIAE/PRO VIRGINITATE CON-/SERVANDA ORANTIS." Signed bottom right: "Ioan. Sadler sculp. et excud./ M. de Cos figurauit." Bottom margin: a poem, beginning: "VIRGO, fida Dei sponsa; ending: "At Diuum excipiat locus. D.R.LD."

title: Drawing, Design for an Embroidery or Woven Fabric of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"
media: brush and light blue, white, and brown gouache on glazed tracing paper
description: Bottom: Three feathers form a horizontal row. From behind rise three more. Upon the left one stand two more in diminishing sizes and of opposite directions in alternate horizontal rows.

title: Drawing, Design for a Table Clock
media: pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on white laid paper
description: Frontal view: A circular frame for dial, surrounded by laurel leaves, mounted on top of a fluted column draped with a garland. Structure sits on base decorated with knobs, cushion feet. Verso: Portrait of a young man, facing left, faintly seen.

title: Print, Plate 14 from Cahier d ornements et frises dessinés (Book of Ornaments and Friezes)
description: Page divided horizontally into two friezes, each with an arabesques. At upper right, a partial trophy. Below, a vase with snake.

title: Sketchbook Folio, Mountain Landscape with Tall Trees
description: Rocky ground in foreground with very tall tree at center. Hill at right, on which there are additional tall trees, with more at left in distance. In background, tall, rocky mountains.

title: Sketchbook Folio, Study of Ocean, Waves, and Clouds
description: Flat sea in foreground, dark sky on left lightens to right

title: Print, Frieze
description: Bottom frieze of the set of three.

title: Sidewall (possibly USA)
description:
Realistic rendering of purple-blue iris, green leaves, on cream ground.

NOTE: 34 duplicates in W131 (61:1:1)

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Palatin
description: Lattice-work pattern forming pointed arches with bunches of flowers between the diamond spaces in white and navy blue.

title: Print, Ammon Begs the King to Summon his Sister Thamar
description:
Ammon, in bed, begs the King to summon his sister Thamar.
Illustration to the following passage in the Book of Samuel: Thamar, Samuel, I, Chap. 13

title: Print, The Large Cat
media:
etching with engraving on off-white laid paper
support: white laid paper

title: Bound Print (France)
description:
Page of text with elaborate border decoration, printed on recto and verso.

Accession numbers for pages with text were assigned long after pages with engraved images had been established.  The sequence for subsequent text pages are as follows:
Text pages 1921-6-207-31/35, after engraving 1921-6-207-2
Text pages 1921-6-207-36/38, after engraving 1921-6-207-3
Text pages 1921-6-207-39, after engraving 1921-6-207-22
Text pages 1921-6-207-40/45, after engraving 1921-6-207-23

title: Print, Vue de la Maison de M. Le Doux (View of Mr. Le Doux's House)
media: etching; black, yellow and green inks on cream paper
description: This is an etching in color of the architect Claude Nicolas Ledoux's house on the rue Poissonière in Paris, a fashionable neighborhood to live in at the time. Janinet is considered the inventor of an innovative aquatint method of etching, involving printing each seperate color one on top of the other. He was the chief color engraver of his time. Other similar "oculus" views of Parisian monuments are also attributed to him, seemingly produced around the same period.

title: Print, View of Amsterdam, ca. 1865
media: drypoint in black ink on cream colored paper
description: Two fishing boats are anchored in a small harbor. Jetty in right foreground and buildings with towers beyond.

title: Print, Peep-show, Vue Generale de la Ville d'Amsterdan du Côté de Tye (A General View of the City of Amsterdam from the Tye)
media: engraving in ink with washes of watercolor on paper, mounted on scrapbook page
description: Peep-show print

title: Print, Peep-show, Vuë Perspective du Palais Royal de la Sarcuela, Maison de Plaisance du Roy d'Espagne
media: engraving in ink with washes of watercolor on paper, mounted on scrapbook page
description: Peep-show print

title: Drawing, Design for One Quarter of a Ceiling with a Central Circular Decoration
media: pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on cream yellow laid paper
description: Horizontal rectangle. One-eight of decoration shown. Center: circular medallion, probably with Aurora, framed by circle with Zodiac signs and mouldings. From corners and from middle of sides rise plant candelabra with winged genii on top, who support festoons. Candelabra connected below by fret band; above, by two branches which border ovoidal panel in which woman dances between tow-hanging trophies. Ceiling bordered by mouldings with frieze. Reverse: above, "quadro longo sara otto palmi." Below, oblong plane written inside: "Largez[z] a  piedi tre/ zechini venti/ zeci 8/ seconda la misura segnata/ da gaetano." (More writing in talian on right, short side, and center right and left.) At lower edge, upper parts of three panels: "Pel la metta di/ questa grandeza/ zechin 8/ per ornati cento scudi/ zec 6/ per figura piu picola/ zechin quatro."  Left: "Galerie sudi 30/ camera da ricev scudi 20/ camera di comp scudi 15/ camera di letto scu 30/ 95."

title: Drawing, Design for a Coronet
media: graphite, pen and ink, brush and watercolor, sepia on paper
description: Above a metal strip, in the center, a knot with a diamond. Two branches, each composed of leaves and buds, are connected on the top.

title: Drawing, Design for an Embroidered or Woven Fabric of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf," Unfinished
media: brush and blue, white gouache on glazed tracing paper pasted on paper
description: A start of the Légion d'honneur is suspended by a chain on a bowknot from behind which laurel boughs rise.

title: Drawing, Elevation of the Entrance Wall of a Hall
media: pen, chinese ink, rose watercolor and ink washes on paper
description: Five fluted pilasters frame wall panels in which three folding doors alternate with two simulated arched window openings. Cast shadow in the top part. Bottom margin: the scale.

title: Cuff (France)
description: Cuff of black taffeta edged with two ruffles of black Chantilly style lace.

title: Panel (China)
description: Pale blue ground with vertical series of landscapes painted in polychrome tempera. At bottom, spotted deer beneath blossoming apple tree. Next two pieces have been joined together leaving an incomplete design of breakwater with another group immediately above it. The next group shows two men talking in a field, one man holding a hoe. Man, woman and child walk toward first two. A natural rocky bridge runs to next group: a water carrier, farmer and ox on a bridge. Above bridge, a house compound beside a great rock with several figures in front of the house. At top, an incomplete group with houses under a great cliff near water. A water carrier and a man with a hoe walk toward houses. Left edge and bottom have blue and white trim

title: Sketchbook Folio, Seascape with Breaking Waves and Light-Filled Sky
media: pen and black ink on off-white wove paper
description: Beach in foreground with breaking waves. Light sky with sun coming through clouds at left.

title: Stick Pin (USA)
description: In form of a cat playing with a pearl ball.

title: Drawing, Floral design for printed textile
media: brush and gouache, graphite on white wove paper
description: Small clusters of white flowers, blue and tan leaves, overlapping ring motifs on brown ground.

title: Print., Conte De Fées [Fairy Tale], Board 78, from La Gazette, No. 10
description: The caption reads: Conte de Fées / Robe du Soir et Robe D’Enfant. Center a young girl in a pink eyelet trimmed day dress and white stockings stands in the center of a snowy dark wooded glen clutching a doll in her right hand.  Back left center a fair fairy-like woman stands with a wand in her right and silver tiara on her head.  She wears a floral patterned thin-strapped drop waist split-front dress with animal forms lining her belt.

title: Ornament (France)
description: Grouped about on top of a cloud are three putti. In their center reclines a female figure with a floral bandeau in her hair, a gold and pearl necklace,and a jewelled belt. She wears a classic draped garment and a scarf is draped about her. Roses are scattered over surface of cloud; printed on blue ground.

title: Panel (France)
description: White-on-white embroidered design of a shield showing three square buckles and three elepants heads on a chevron. Above the shield are a helmut, a mitre with three elephant heads and two crosses. Mantling of leaf scrolls. Below are rose plants and flowers resembling geraniums with a bird at either side. Motto is "Hinc Mihi Salvus" or "Hence My Salvation."

title: Print, Exterior of the Duke's Theater, Dorset Gardens, London, After a 17th Century Book Illustration
Textile (possibly Italy)
description: Densely packed organic plant forms in green silk with gold and silver metal.

title: Handkerchief, In Memoriam
description: Printed handkerchief with a three-quarter portrait bust of Queen Victoria in the center. At the top, "In Memoriam." At the bottom: "Alexandrina - Victoria Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland Empress of India." On the left side: "Born in Kensington Palace May 24th, 1819." On the right side "Died in Osborne House Jan'y 22nd, 1901." Printed in black on a white ground, with a black and white striped border.

title: Oyster Shell Matchsafe, late 19th century
description: In the form of an oyster shell, with a cluster of seaweed near bottom on front. Wide, upper part (lid) flips back, hinge on reverse. Striker on canted side.

title: Frieze And Border (France)
description: Suspended in arched framework with pendants, orange flowers hanging from brown foliage.

title: Fragment (France)
description: Fragment shows a man seated under a tree reading to two women. They are surrounded by trees, leafy vegetation and flowers.

title: Fragment (France)
description: Fragment shows a man and woman seat on a hillside under trees. In red on white.

title: Drawing, Design for a Lunette with Allegory of Sculpture
media: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk, traces of graphite on laid paper
description: Woman works at inscription of herm. At left, minerva seated looking on. Boy stands at right by pedestal, drawing or writing upon tablet. Paintings, tools, sculptures lean against wall. Caption on top: "scultura".

title: Drawing, Imaginary Classical Temple in the Mountains
media: black chalk on cream wove paper
description: Stairs, high building with portico in front, all situated on substructure. Two figures in classical attire, one seated, one standing below steps, extending right arms.  Background at right, trees, at left, top of trees and mountains.

title: Drawing, Two Victories in Roundels
media: pen and brown ink, brush with brownish grey wash on rough laid paper
description:
Vertical rectangle top: circular medallion with Victory in chariot, directed toward left.  Bottom: ovoidal medallion with two female genii raising wreaths above, panoply. Caption above top medallion, "Vittorie;" and bottom medallion "Vittore"

Captions, as in 1901-39-3259: "Vittorie." Verso: part of pen sketch similar to 1901-39-3259.

title: Sketchbook Folio, Holy Trinity with the Dead Christ in Glory after Palma Giovane; Adoration of the Magi, Study after Lodovico Carracci
media: pen and brown ink, brush and dark brown wash over traces of black chalk on white laid paper
description: Upper drawing of Reclining Christ figure on clouds supported by putti and God the Father. Lower drawing of the Adoration of the Magi with the Holy Family at right and the Kings at left; an ox at center back- ground.

title: Fragment
description: Nine stripes in purple, green and orange each separated from the next by lines of yellow and white. each stripe has conventionalized foliate design.

title: Cape For An Ecclesiastical Figurine (France)
description: Small cape for an ecclesiatic figure, the "Bambino". Blue silk grosgrain with grapevine design embroidered in white and cream coloured glass beads and silver sequins along the edge. Lined with blue silk twill.

title: Drawing, River Scene, Grand Canyon, Colorado
media: brush and ink wash on cream wove paper
description: Horizontal view of hills on either side of a river in the middle ground, with a windmill topping the left hill.  A bridge crosses the water nearby and a group of three people stands near the lower left corner.

title: Drawing, Clouds Over Hills, Jamaica
media: brush and oil paint on cardboard
description: Hilly country at dusk. Trees are shown in the foreground.

title: Drawing, Mt. Katahdin from Togue Pond
Drawing, Design for a Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"
media: brush and light blue and white gouache on glazed tracing paper
description: A moulding and a crest border formed by leaves are at the bottom. Plant caldelabra are to rise from each fifth leaf. Baskets with a plant each are to stand upon a slit spital base in the intervals.

title: Drawing, Design for a Woven or Embroidered Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"
media: brush and white and light blue gouache on glazed tracing paper
description: Fringed lace shawls for a row of festoons with bunches of flowers rising from the knots.

title: Drawing, Design for an Embroidered or Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"
media: brush and white gouache, graphite on glazed tracing paper
description: A row of four hanging boughs, with a seed, three leaves, and a blossom in each of them.

title: Teapot And Lid
media: lead-glazed earthenware with green underglaze decoration
description: Gently conical body with slightly domes shoulder, curved spout, ribbed strap handle. Cover is domes with pointed knob. Body and cover are ribbed and striped with green.

title: Dutch mahogany metamorphic wing-backed folding bed chair Bed Chair
media: mahogany, solid and veneered, inlaid with other woods, textile
description: Double arched top rail, crested with a complex of scrolls.  Wood wings rest on slightly curved arms which are supported by curved channeled  stumps.   Flat seat framing.  Cabriole front and rear legs.  Chair inlaid on all surfaces with floral designs.  Unfolds to form bed.

title: Drawing, Arabesque Design for a Panel
media: pen and ink, brush and wash on paper
description: Gaine with the bust of Dionysus supporting a bowl full of bunches of grapes and leaves from which a faun with a thyrsus and two acanthus scrolls rise.  A disk with roses and a trophy are suspended from the scroll at right.  A flower basket standing upon the head of the half-figure of a lion, below.  The left half shows the half-figure of a lion supporting a flower basket over which a thyrsus rises and to which a trophy of pastoral musical instruments is fastened.  Framing strip.

title: Drawing, Wall Elevation of Bedroom Alcove
media: pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on white laid paper
description: Elevation of a section of a painted wall showing an alcove at center hung with tasseled draperies above a day bed with blue pillows. Predominate color scheme is white, blue and gold. Trophies on side walls include quivers, arrows, swords, ribbons and doves, possibly indicating a theme of love.

title: Drawing, Three Days on the Front
media: black and white chalk on blue paper
description: A wounded soldier attempts to rise off the ground. Vague sketches of figures appear at right.

title: Drawing, Wounded Soldier
media: graphite on wove paper, laid down
description: Horizontal view of a wounded soldier, half-reclining with his arm in a sling while a nurse leans over him from the left, and an officer stands to the right, apparently on a ship's deck with distant view of buildings.

title: Bound Print, Dessein de l’illumination et du feu d’artifice donné à Monseigneur le Dauphin à Meudon le 3e septembre 1735 (Design of the Illumination and Fireworks dedicated to His Grace the Dauphin at Meudon, September 3rd, 1735)
description: Exterior view of the gardens of the Palace at Versailles during a fireworks display for Louis XV, King of France. An arched colonnade trellis with two three-tiered fountains at left and right; ornately fashioned topiaries and plants in the other intervals, with a tree upon a pedestal at the center back. Within the semi-circular stage, a man wearing an animal skin slays two fantastic beasts with a large club. His left foot steps on the dragon at left, from whose mouth emits trails of smoke. (Figures are larger than life, possibly a sculptural group depicting one of the trials of Hercules.) In the background, a large circle of light at lower center, with arcs of fireworks spiraling out in all directions, illuminating the treetops at either side. In the foreground, an audience of figures—the male and female spectators sit on wooden chairs and stand in groups watching the display.

title: Drawing, Iron Gates of the Mint, Paris
media: pen and black ink, brush and blue, brown, gray wash, with black chalk indications on paper with mounted overleaf
description:
The gate set in a rusticated wall.  The gate itself consists of two wings with two vertically oriented panels making up each wing.  Centered in the upper panels are circular medallions with the royal chiffre (initials), surrounded by two laurel branches.  Above entablature is the winged royal coat of arms between two cornucopias and flanked below by laurel twigs.  
The alternate drawing for the lunette is attached at the top to main sheet on a separate piece of paper.  The alternative suggestion shows an enriched variation of the design of the lunette.  An entablature in the shape of a pediment is supported by the points of the cornucopia.  The crown lies upon the pediment with the heads of two maces.  The coat of arms is framed by an oval band with the chain of the Order of the Holy Spirit hanging from the entablature and the badge being in front of the crossing point of the laurel branches, leaves of which help to support the oval band.

title: Print, Moutardier (Mustard Pot), plate 60, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part
description: Pot made completely out of shells and feathery leaves; finial made of leaves; handle of one feathery leaf.

title: Print, Pot à Oille (Soup Tureen), plate 78, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part
description: Tureen body, foot (shaped like fishtail), and lid made of shells ornamented with various kinds of leaves, handles made of twisted vines. At center, a crown and finial made of a plumed helmet, alongside a headless fish and arrows.

title: Print, The Satyr Family
description: A satyr stands at left, playing a flute. A woman is seated on an animal skin, at right, holding a child on her lap. Trees in the background.

title: Print, Bishops Nicholas, Ulric, Erasmus
media: woodcut and black ink on paper
description: Three bishops standing. The one in the center holds an open book in has right hand and a fish and staff in his left hand. The bishop on the left appears to be holding a tray of bread, and the bishop on the right gestures with an open hand. In the background, a doric column and suggestion of barrel vault. Durer's monogram on lower right.

title: Photograph, Photograph of 3, square Jasmin (under construction); View of Rear Façade after Masonry Jointing (“Vue de la Façade Posterieure de la 1re Construction Standard après le jointoiement des Pierres Agglomereès”), from album “System and Elements whose Ownership is Restricted to Standard-Construction, Franchise-Holder of Guimard’s 10 Patents” (“Système et Éléments dont la Propriété est Réservée au Standard-Construction Concessionnaire des 10 Brevets Guimard”)
media: photographic print on sensitized paper mounted on gray paper
description: A photograph belonging to a series showing the construction of one of the mass-operational houses designed by Guimard for the post-World War I.

title: Print, Christ in Limbo (Harrowing of Hell), from The Little Passion Series
description: Christ is in right foreground, holding his banner in his left hand, and with his right assisting an old man. A group of men and women stand at left. The cross is seen at upper left. Monogram of Dürer at lower right.

title: Purse (France)
description: Small purse of white silk crocheted net with clusters of steel beads. Ring of cut steel to close. Top finished with two small bars, steel chain.

title: Fragment (China)
description: Fragment of red velvet with cut pile in a satin ground. Design of peonies, butterflies, bats, coins and small swastikas.

title: Print, Rocaille (rococo design), in Nouveaux morceaux pour des paravents (New concepts for screens)
description: A shell-work fountain on a mound of rockwork in the foreground, with two monkeys at the left. In the background, a temple portico houses another fountain, with vase and pyramid beside it.

title: Sidewall (England)
description: On a white background a freely painted, bold design of rose branches, bearing gray, red and yellow blossoms and green, brown, and black foliage upon which sit a small finch and a larger partridge-like bird. In the background, gray silhouettes of branches and foliage. Straight repeat, half drop match.

title: Textile (France)
description: Sample of white taffeta divided into vertical columns by narrow satin stripes in orange and black. Columns are filled with a dense arrangement of multicolored flowers. Both selvedges present.

title: Drawing, Stained glass window: left pane of a three part design
Fragment (Italy)
description: Fragment of stylized floral and foliated forms in a large scale symmetric scroll design. Pattern connected by brides, picotées, and is interspersed by gaze quadrillée and portes.

title: Border (Belgium)
description: Border of six triangular pendants filled by an abstract pattern.

title: Border (Italy)
description: Border of asymmetric floral clusters placed in a dense pattern.

title: Dado (France)
description:
Dado with inset panels. Printed in shades of blue and white on beige ground.

H#589

title: Dado (France), 1790
description:
Inset panel dado printed in grisaille: bead-and-reel motif on the interior of molding.

H# 314 ?

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Top portion of trellis panel: on light blue ground, pink wild roses and foliage on white trellis.

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: On cream ground, small-scale ogival pattern with stylized floral in-fills printed in blue.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Treff, 1910–32
description: On white ground, partial view of pattern design with a row of pink clovers and leaves at top and blue flowers attached to stems and vines.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Rhombus
description: Chocolate brown ground with ochre double stripes and an ochre diamond form evenly spaced between.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Thymian
description: Stylized branch and bud pattern with an abstracted rectilinear network in taupe, magenta, and white.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Distel (Thistle)
description: Purple ground with orange and white flowers

title: 1921 Plate
description: Circular, slightly shaped edge; the inscription "1921" intersperced among stylized floral motifs

title: Edging, early 20th century
description: Edge of bobbin lace, triangular scallop edge; early 20th century Buckinghamshire.

title: Textile
description: One of seven pages from a printed fabric sample book. Page is double-sided.

title: Vase (Switzerland)
description: Light blue glass with cobalt blue glass decoration.

title: Bandbox Lid (United States or England)
description: Hunters and dogs in landscapes set within bright green scroll frames and alternating with decorative cartouches.

title: Vase (USA)
description: Buff clay body, thrown. Ovoid body with swelling at shoulder, truncated neck - no foot. Carved in relief, recessed ground, design of Spanish moss-covered oak trees encircling body, against background of underbrush and sky; lower quarter of design below tress is undecorated. Waxy matte glazes of blue, green and blue-green; sky is cream matte glaze. Interior is cream matte glaze. Bottom not glazed. Crazing to glaze.

title: Sidewall, Oranges and Lemons Say the Bells of St. Clements
description: An orange and a lemon tree laden with fruit are growing side by side. A group of children have formed a circle around citrus trees and are probably playing "Oranges and Lemons". Daisies are growing in the grass. Designed for Jeffrey and Co. of London. Now produced at the Sanderson mill from original rollers.

title: Print, Plate 6, from Die Folge der phantastischen Schmucksträβe (Suite of Fantastic Ornamental Bouquets)
description: Rising from the left bottom corner grotesque animals are shown; spiral vegetal motif; fish-like creature.

title: Abstract Sunburst Reserve with Tear Drop Border Matchsafe
description: Rectangular, rounded corners, reverse slightly concave, with polychrome enamel and etched decoration, the square central reserve features open circle with monogram, the border of which is punctuated by alternating light blue and red square sections with perforations in center of each, on dark blue enamel ground an etched zig-zag design resembling sunrays radiates outwards from circle, square central reserve bordered on top and bottom by pink-beige strips with etched curly lines at each end, the center of each featuring light blue and yellow semi-circles with sawtoothed etched borders, outermost border comprised of alternating light and dark blue bands punctuated by tear drop motifs in yellow and red enamel, each of which has single perforation at their center; sides and reverse have gold wash on surface. Lid hinged on upper left side. Striker in recessed groove on bottom.

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Repeating pattern of stylized floral motif. Small white flower on four leaves, attached to short stem.

title: Sidewall (possibly England)
description: Full width, the end of a roll, giving one and one-half repeats of a pattern of serpentine vine, with conventionalized fruit, against a conventionalized all-over background of simple foliate forms with accents of gold circles. Paper embossed in vertical ribbing. Printed in tans, blue-greens and gold.

title: Brisé Fan
media: carved, pierced and painted ivory sticks, silk ribbon
description: Brisé fan. Ivory sticks carved and pierced in conventional design and painted in floral ornament. Red satin ribbon.

title: Wood Engraving. Vignette.
description: A trophy of classical arms. Two wreaths are included.

title: Textile, Möven
description: Island with palm trees, stars, seagulls; (a) white on black; (b) brown, light blue and peach on ivory; (c) light brown, light blue and pink on ivory.

title: Platter (England)
description: Oval form, the white ground  transfer-printed with Chinese- or Japanese-inspired polychrome decoration including plants, butterflies, fan, vase of flowers, screen, and geometric patterns. The rim with tan band and brown decoration.

title: Textile (India)
description: The design is a border pattern with the mordant for red painted on the cloth, then dyed, and accents of yellow hand painted.

title: Fragment
description: Trailing pink ribbons interspersed with garlands of pink, lavendar and yellow flowers on ivory ground.

title: Print, Plate 31, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)
description: Rocaille design with large seashell at center full of foliage.

title: Tile Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty tiles wide and twenty-three tiles high with opening for fireplace eleven tiles wide and ten high.  Foliage arabesques disposed about three vertical axes from which are emphazised by urns at center and right, and at left by the figure of a standing woman carrying an infant on her arm and accompanied by two children.

title: Wall Facing (Holland)
description:
Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Wall Facing (Holland)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

description: A pavilion rises in the left foreground.  An enormous cloud is shown in the center.  A narrow top and a broad bottom margin show the grayish ground color.  On verso:  indistinct unfinished pencil sketch of a mountainous landscape.

description: A partly naturalistic partly stylized rose bough with blossoms and leaves forms vertical rows. Somewhat more than one repeat is shown.

description: A fantastic plant fills the hollow of a pointed crest border over which it rises. Four repeats are shown.

title: Drawing, Wall Elevation of a Bedroom Alcove
media: pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on white laid paper
description: White-toned walls with blue accents. A day bed is arranged in an alcove, under draped canopy, against a bouquet of flowers, lyre, and a water bird painted on the back wall.

title: Drawing, Design for a Silver Coffee Urn
media: pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash, graphite on wove paper
description: Shown from side with spout at left.  A spherical quadrangle as a base is supported by beads.  Four fluted gaines with lion feet hold the body which is shaped like part of an egg and shows a lion mask with ring. The cover topped by a knob.

gouache
support: varnished laid paper laid down on beige wove paper

Simplified rosette in the interstices with four fleur-de-lys forms extending from it. Printed in violet-blue on an undyed linen ground.

Over it the Dove before a triangle. Rays, stars. Laterally are shown the triple mounts and the stars of the coat of arms of Pope Clement XI (1700–1721).

description: Escutcheon with the title of a map of Spain and Portugal by Janvier.  Escutcheon with the coat of arms of Spain, a European and an Indian crown, a mace, on top, with the coat of arms of Portugal at the left bottom.

title: Print, Recueil D'Architecture Civile...
description:
Title page, frontispiece (dessine par Belanger, Boutroy sculpsit, Demoiselle Vallet, scripsit), text 1-22, 20 cahiers, 120 plates.

Architecture & floorplans, Gardens & garden architecture.

Dessine par J. C. Krafft, Joseph Lecointe, Wandlaincourt, Vanlemcour, et grave par Boudrois, Boullay, Hibon, Van-Maelle, Chamon, Gentot, a Paris chez Crapelet, 1812.

title: Drawing, Project for a painted panel
media: pen and ink with water color washes on paper
description: Rinceaux, grotesques and garlands set off a single figure medallion, above, and a horizontal panel below, showing figures classically dressed. Probably a decorative scheme for Robert Adam. Below, a scale, without numerical indication.

title: Fragment (Germany)
description: Fragment of a blue and white floral damask with scalloped partial border.

title: Photograph, Partial View of Mme Guimard's Bedroom, Hôtel Guimard, 122 rue Mozart, Paris XVI
media: sepia or carbon print on white wove paper, lined on brown paper
description: Photograph of Madame Guimard's bedroom at Hector Guimard's house at 122 rue Mozart. Photograph depicts two windows, a chair and mirror in the center, and a vanity on the right.

title: Pair of Trousers Matchsafe
description: In the form of a pair of trousers with creases, back pocket, suspenders draped over hips, tool pouch on right hip, overall surface textured to simulate fabric. Flat, flip top lid hinged above tool pouch. Striker on bottom.

title: Winged female Matchsafe
description: Oblong, with rounded corners, vertical sides curved, featuring winged, nude female: she is poised, legs slightly bent, on lily pads, framed by flower and leafy tendrils. Her hair flows beneath her waist, wings resemble dragonfly's wings, two insect-like antennae on top of her head. Reverse surface has undulating curves but is undecorated. Lid hinged on side. Striker recessed into bottom.

title: Ceiling Paper (USA)
description: Grid or trellis pattern formed by foliate scrolls. The scrolls at the intersections are filled in with light blue, which alterante with light blue wreaths in adjoining voids. Printed on tan ground.

title: Towel (Italy)
description: At each end of the rectangular bast fiber diamond-twill towel, a blue cotton band with griffons alternating with a symmetrical geometric tree. The band is bordered at top and bottom by the repeated words "Perugia" alternately in mirror image. Warp fringe at end about 10.2cm or 4" long.

title: Drawing, Façade with the Albani Arms
media: pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, black chalk on white wove paper
description: Vertical rectangle. Building with two stories, the lower with five divisions and the upper with three. Stairs lead to the lateral left door and parallel to the façade to a ramp in front of the central part. At right, oblique stairs lead simultaneously to the lateral door and the ramp. The three doorcases are topped by a coat of arms, at left and in the center identified as that of the Albani. Tablets are above the door frames at left and in the center, respectively, with the inscriptions: ALEXANDER ALBANVS; ANNIBAL ALBANVS; posts are at the foot of the ramp.

title: Square
description: Bobbin lace square, floral forms; late 18th century Bruges

title: Album Page, Black Forest Sketches
media: graphite, on cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
description: Vertical sheet with frayed bottom and right edge.  Illustrated are sketches of buildings and architectural features.  Beginning from top left are two domed steeples, both with shingled onion-shaped cupolas and tall finials. At right is an elevation of a timbered building with a large, deep gable on both stories which shade open windows with shutters.  In the center is a very small sketch of a dormer within a shingled or tiled roof.  At lower left is likely the same gabled building sketched on the  upper half of the sheet, but now viewed from a corner angle, the gables supported by very large timbers which the artist identifies as being "at least 3 ft."  At lower right is a very quickly sketched tiled or shingled roof with an awkwardly oversize "bell" cupola, as it is named by the artist.  The cupola projects from the roof on a very thin support, and balloons above it.  The cupola is shingled, and terminates in a small ball finial with weathervane.

title: Print, Sea-Side Sketches – A Clam-Bake
media: wood engraving in black ink on paper
description: Two boys carrying a pail turn their heads away from the dead fish in the lower right, while a group of young boys on the beach build a fire.  One prepares to steam or bake clams.

title: Print, On the Road to Lake George
media: wood engraving in black ink on paper
description: View of a coach and four, with a figure waving to three children in a field with their berry pails.

title: Album, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Print, Hamamatsu, Wintertime, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)
media: woodblock print (ukiyo-e) on mulberry paper (washi), ink with color
description: Here is the subdued scene of farmers warming themselves by a fire under a giant cryptomeria tree overlooks the famous battlefield of Mikatagahara and castle of the first Tokugawa shogun, Ieyasu.

title: Drawing, Ceiling Decoration, probably for the Conservatory/Music Room
media: brush and watercolor, gouache, pen and black ink on thick white wove paper
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Detail of a design for a ceiling divided into three compartments: a square and two half-oval sections. About one quarter of the design is shown, with the square containing the painted representation of a clouded sky, surmounted by a balustrade and a wide trellis-work border. The oval contains bamboo in striped pattern. Red Chinese fret. The shape tells us that it was intended for the conservatory. Roof is painted in imitation of the teakwood and rosewood.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

title: Drawing, Wallpaper Design
media: brush and gouache, graphite on white paper
description: A dado is shown at the bottom, an entablature consisting of a few moldings beneath two darkly colored stripes on top. The moldings at the bottom of the entablature are colored yellow and brown and show ornamentations. The panel is dark blue and decorated in white. Vertical stems with leaves and seeds support a horizontal band which shows clasp motifs alternating with rosettes. The vertical stems are continued above the band by calyx stands with petals. They are connected by semicircles formed by boughs and a rosette. Shorter boughs form incomplete semicircles, beneath the upper ones.

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Faux aqua-colored marble brick or ashlar block pattern. A framework of crossed ribbons, acanthus diamonds and pyramid bosses encases each simulated marble block.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Skorpion (Scorpion)
description: Checked pattern in yellow, blue, taupe, and white.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Marina
description: Wave pattern in gray and pink.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Archibald
description: Diamond pattern in gray, green, purple, and white.

description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty-seven tiles wide and twenty-one high with opening for door or window nineteen and one-half tiles high and twelve wide.  To left and right of opening, centered canopy above. Left, woman representing Hope, right, a sculputure urn.  Centered above opening, a mascaron.  Arabesque design of foliage.

description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty tiles wide and twenty-three tiles high with opening for fireplace eleven tiles wide and ten high.  Foliage arabesques disposed about three vertical axes from which are emphazised by urns at center and right, and at left by the figure of a standing woman carrying an infant on her arm and accompanied by two children.

title: Handkerchief (England)
description: At the top: "Jubilee of Queen Victoria 1887." In the center, a three-quarter portrait medallion of Queen Victoria, with a banner below reading "Her Most Excellent Victoria, Queen of Great Britain & Ireland & Empress of India. Center medallion is surrounded by portrait medallions of the royal family, with the Prime Ministers in the four corners. Printed in black on white.

title: Drawing, The Blue Room, Schloss Fischbach
media: brush and watercolor, graphite on white paper
description:
The Blue Room, most likely a dining room, is decorated in the Gothic Revival Style. 
A view of the beautiful countryside of Silesia is visible through the center window, with its stained glass upper transom, located in the seating alcove. The entrance to the alcove is hung with a blue-tasseled pelmet and white curtains. A religious painting, at left, is juxtaposed with flowers, plants, a desk, an etagere and a dining table, elements of a comfortable room in a country house. Both the green rug, bordered in a rose-flower pattern, and the central chandelier are influenced by Victorian decoration. An adjacent room, in pink tones, is seen at right.

title: Print, Plate 3 (recto) and plate 4 (verso), Description of the Celebrations Given by the City of Strasbourg, from the series Fêtes de Strasbourg
description:
Plate 3 (recto) within rocaille border topped with the coat of arms of France: 25 lines of text, “Maréchal de Coigny, donna de même jour un repas splendides… qu’aux Enfans. Pour satisfaire une ardeur si louable, on choisit…”

Plate 4 (verso) within rocaille border topped by a cartouche with the cipher of Louix XV: 25 lines of text, “dans le grand nombre douze à quatorze cens hommes, que l’on distribua… Les Sabres de ces deux Officiers étoient montés et garnis de…”

title: Print, Plate 15 (recto) and plate 16 (verso), Description of the Celebrations Given by the City of Strasbourg, from the series Fêtes de Strasbourg
description:
Plate 15 (recto) within rocaille border: 25 lines of text, “les fenêtres du Roi, et apres quelques instans toute la machine éclata… Le Magistrat fit abandonner au peuple sur la place de l’Hôtel…”

Plate 16 (verso) within rocaille border topped with a cartouche with the cipher of Louis XV: 25 lines of text, “de Ville, un bœuf entier roti, farci et entouré de toutes sortes de viandes… pluiseurs danses et plusieurs jeux avec des cerceaux quils tenoient à la main.”

title: Print, Plate 17 (recto) and plate 18 (verso), Description of the Celebrations Given by the City of Strasbourg, from the series Fêtes de Strasbourg
description:
Plate 17 (recto) within rocaille border topped with coat of arms of France: 25 lines of text, “Cette Troupe étoit précedée et con duile par plusieurs Officiers, maitres du… serpenteaux, de fusées, de gerbes de feu, de balles luisantes, de bombes d’ar-…”

Plate 18 (verso) within rocaille border topped with coat of arms of france: 25 lines of text, “-tifie, qui tantôt en s’élevant, tantôt en se plongeant dans l’eau formoient… leurs Officiers éxéculerent leurs jeux et leurs danses avec epées devant…”

title: Album Page, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again, 1901
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Plate Plate
media: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold
description: Circular form with scalloped edge and shallow well; wide rim glazed light blue, molded with five floral sprigs and scalloped edge, reserved in white; edge picked out in gilding; in center, a polychrome bouquet encircled by gilded vine motif, all on white ground.

title: Wall Facing (Holland), ca. 1725
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty-seven tiles wide and twenty-one high with opening for door or window nineteen and one-half tiles high and twelve wide.  To left and right of opening, centered canopy above. Left, woman representing Hope, right, a sculputure urn.  Centered above opening, a mascaron.  Arabesque design of foliage.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands), ca. 1725
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty-seven tiles wide and twenty-one high with opening for door or window nineteen and one-half tiles high and twelve wide.  To left and right of opening, centered canopy above. Left, woman representing Hope, right, a sculputure urn.  Centered above opening, a mascaron.  Arabesque design of foliage.

title: Book Illustration, Kaigara Danmen Zuan (Cross sections of seashells)
Lamp Shade, 1907
description: (a) Flower bud form glass shade for sconce. Over-all iridescent finish with green, yellow, orange tones predominating. Green veined, pointed leaf forms rise from base. Out-curving lip with five indentations giving lip slightly lobed outline. (b, c, d, and e) Same basic shapes, colors, free forms of leaves varying slightly. Color variation most noticeable in (c) where color is darker.

title: Fragment, possibly 17th century
description: Fragment of continuous tape in design of wavy, ribbon-like floral pattern with bars connecting motifs.

title: Fragment
description: Fragment of continuous tape bobbin made lace.

title: Print, Interior of a Dutch Cottage, from "Etchings of Pictures in the Metropolitan Museum, New York"
description: A woman sits at the hearth. A man and a cow are in the background.

title: Drawing, Project: decoration for a panel
media: pen and ink, charcoal, on paper
description: This a moulded frame of a vertical oblong. Inside are tangent panels, with empty squares in the outer corners between. In the top section are two stags upon and beside a lath and scroll motif. At the two side panels are figures of women standing in niches below canopies, the niches are constructed as laths, and supported by figures of satyresses. In the lower panel are boys sitting upon goats and climbing podium steps.

title: Drawing, Four Caryatids
media: pen and dark brown ink, brush with sepia wash over traces of graphite on light blue laid paper
description: Figures one beside the other; first and fourth raising both arms; third raises right; second figure crosses arms.

title: Drawing, The North Dome, Yosemite, California
media: brush and black wash, white gouache, graphite on tan wove paper
description: Vertical view of jagged rocks in foreground with rushing stream leading back through pines on valley floor to the North Dome of Yellowstone.

title: Drawing, Colombia or Ecuador, mountains
media: brush and oil paint on paperboard

title: Drawing, Summer View, Hudson Valley, New York
description: Horizontal view over the hills in summertime, under a cloud filled sky.

title: Drawing, Imaginary Landscape
media: pen and dark brown ink on off-white laid paper

title: Drawing, Tree; Verso: View of a church, two English women of 1636, study of a horse
Plaque (England)
description: Square with white decoration on greenish-blue ground consists of a kneeling woman wearing conical hat, long robe, watering a plant in classical vase at left, from which a cherub rises.

title: Drawing, Brooch
media: pen and ink, white heightening on paper
description: An escutcheon with a vase on top and two scrolls forming the sides. Below hang three pearls.

title: Sconce
description: crown and shield

title: Print, Emblematical Figures in Artificial Stone over the Pelican Office Lombard Street
description: Above, European Magazine; below, on plinth: CHILDREN ENDOWD and PROPERTY SECURED / BY THE PELICAN LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY; below, center: Published by J. Sewell Cornhill May 1, 1801.

title: Print, Ornamenti o Grottesche (Grotesque Ornament)
description: Vertical rectangle showing a symmetrical design on the theme of the hunt. Two board’s heads hang from a vertical spear. Below, a hunting horn and two stag heads.

title: Drawing, Design for Staircase, Voorst Castle, The Hague, Netherlands
media: pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, traces of black chalk on white laid paper
description: Drawing in three registers. Palace courtyard visible through Corinthean portico. In left niche, Apollo; at center, Abundance and attendants; at right, Diana. Top register, figures amidst clouds. Bottom register, Daphne and Apollo between caryatids.

title: Drawing, Drummer Seen from the Back
media: charcoal, white chalk on blue-green wove paper
description:
Recto: vertical view of the back of a drummer, shown facing left, and holding a drum.
Verso: vertical view of a soldier with an extended sword; and in horizontal direction from bottom to top are three soldiers who appear to be fighting.

title: Drawing, Soldiers in a Sleigh or Wagon
media: graphite on wove paper, laid down
description: Horizontal very rough sketch indicating soldiers in a sleigh or wagon (possibly).

title: Print, Vignette, The Pelican in the Crown of Thorns
description: Three little birds drink from the wound.

title: Drawing, One of Sixteen Scenes of the Death and Burial of a Man
media: japan watercolor on silk or paper
description: From a series of sixteen scenes of the death and burial of a man in Japan.

title: Drawing, One of Sixteen Scenes of the Death and Burial of a Man
media: japan watercolor on silk or paper
description: From a series of sixteen scenes of the death and burial of a man in Japan.

title: Drawing, Project for a Fountain
media: black chalk, pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper
description: A fountain composed of pairs of figures, from top to bottom: putti, dolphins, mermaids, swans. Water flows from a vase-shaped finial.

title: Drawing, Project for an embroidered vertical border
media: incised lines, gouache colors, glazed heavy paper
description: Bunches of flowers are to alternate beside a vertical garland. A row of beads, two stripes outside at left.

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Vertical rectangle. Fountain from which drink confronted reindeer with lowered heads. At top, arch with radiating fluting, from which hang two harps. This is the top portion of a much larger arabesque design.

title: Print
description: Escutcheon with the title of the map of the British Isles in classical times, in "Atlas Universel" by Robert de Vaugondy, Paris, 1757.  The left top corner of the map.  Emblems of commerce and the sea are in the framing.

title: Dress For An Ecclesiastical Figurine
description: Garment has a full skirt and sleeveless bodice with eyelets for lacing down the back. Blue fabric is a ribbed silk heavily brocaded with silver, gold and multicolored threads in a floral design. Bodice is lined with rose-colored taffeta.

title: Black Basalt Teapot with Sybil Finial Teapot And Cover
description: Of squat globular form with tapering cylindrical spout, loop handle joined to upturned and everted lip around circular mouth;  body decorated with vertical stripes and one narrow horizontal band; circular lid decorated with radiating strips; finial in form of sitting, robed female figure.

title: Decorative Door Boss And Nail
description: Square type, pierced and embossed with wrought lines. Quadrant design, the terminal spade-shaped elements in each quadrant pierced for secondary nails. Nails with round heads on square shank.

title: Sidewall, Single Stem
description: Flowers and scrolling foliage with pale foliage arabesque underlay. Printed in orange, blue and green on cream ground.

title: Print, Copy of Bacchante, a Satyr, and a Faun, from the series Scherzi di Fantasia
description: In the center, a compact group of a bacchante, a satyr and a female faun. They face left. The bacchante holds a thyrsus in her left hand and her right hand rests on a vase. In the background, trees.

title: Plate, Etching (USA)
description: Sheet metal. On one side, engraved script reading "Feb. 12, 1879-1889". Reverse, plan. Corners cut at angle of 45 degrees. Small punched hole with yellowed ribbon in upper left corner.

title: Print, Theatre des Varietés in Paris
description: Horizontal rectangle. From the same publication as -1392. Shown from the boulevard. Signatures and name of the publication as in -1392. The number is 77: "VUE DU THEATRE DES VARIETES SURE LE BOULEVARD"

title: Print, Diverses/Figures Chinoises
description:
Chinoiserie
titlepage and 1-12

title: Sleeve Ruffle
description: Sleeve ruffle in a pattern showing freely-placed floral sprays and cartouche.

title: Print, The Dancing Peasants
description: Two peasants dancing. The woman, facing the spectator, moves toward the right. The man, his back turned, lifts his left hand.

title: Textile (France)
description: Small quilt, white linen, embroidered in polychrome wools. Design of slender undulating vine, rising vertically; detached natural size flower groups between vine stems. Background quilted, simple diagonal pattern; lined with white linen.

title: Textile (France), ca. 1920
description: Chiné-printed ribbon has a muted zigzag pattern and small flowers in soft colors. Over this are woven lobed medallions containing stylized symmetrical floral forms with narrow blue borders containing rosettes.

title: Textile, ca. 1919
description: Sample of white taffeta divided into vertical columns by narrow satin stripes in orange and black. Columns are filled with a dense arrangement of multicolored flowers. Both selvedges present.

title: Trimming, early 20th century
description: Trimming with green and yellow flowers.

title: Drawing, Design for a Candelabrum.
media: pencil, ink, watercolor, tempera colors on tracing paper
description: The body of the lamp is a blue porcelain vase with an oval central field depicting a pair of figures against a light background, enclosed in a narrow gold frame.  Mounted on a bronze base, surmounted by a candelabrum in the form of branches with leaves and flowers, the candle-holder rising from the flowers.  Inscribed lower left: "Candelabra porcel. and Bronze a 9 bougies;" at lower right "hauteur 84c;" lower center: "No.70."

title: Print, Dedication page, from Neüw Grotteßken Buch (New Grotesque Book)
description: An elaborate composed of cartilage-like ornament with grotesques, containing the title. Below, figures purchase ornamental objects at a show.

title: Drawing, Floral design for printed textile
media: brush and gouache, graphite on white wove paper
description: Multi-colored floral pattern on white ground, line graphite border.

title: Covered Dish
description: A) Dish in the shape of a bunch of grapes, with vine and leaves on cover. B) White inside, mottled bluish purple on outside; leaves green.

title: piano Miniature Of A Piano
description: Grand piano. Lid can be raised. Scrolled front legs, baluster rear leg. All-over decoration on case and rack of scrolled and rosetted filigree.

title: Border (Belgium)
description: Band with a  scalloped border of floral blossoms, powdered over ground and edge by floral sprays.

title: Border
description: Border  with an open pattern of floral sprays emerging from stylized horn of plenty.

title: Border (Italy)
description: Wide border of two rows of squares bordered at one side by pendants. Squares and pendants filled by circular blossoms.

title: Cap Streamers (France)
description: Design shows serpentine garlands of small-scale flowers and leaves with connecting bow-knots in repeat pattern. Fond: réseau, cordonnet. Modes: portes.

title: Decoupage, Fisherwoman with a Catch
media: graphite, brush and watercolor on vellum with various fabrics
description: A standing fisherwoman wears red hose and a blue apron.  She holds a large fish in her left hand.  Sailing craft visible in the background, and a flower and stump in the foreground.

title: 4058 Dish
description: Oval dish with rim extended at short ends to form handles that are pierced with two holes on each. Decoration same as on 1959-155-1.

title: Border (France)
description: Olive drab ground. Rigidly regular row of three small pink bud clusters alternating with large stylized tubrous white and gray flower with black stamen on "collar" of black leaves. Flowers linked by scalloped line. Narrow black and pink lines edging top, wider black bands at bottom enclosing band of light brown with continuous white diamond pattern.

title: Band (Italy)
description: Narrow band with a diamond-shaped flower pattern.

title: Fragment
description: Fragment of a band with flowers.

title: Band (Italy)
description: Band of withdrawn element with pointed lace edge attached.

title: Bound Print, Altro spaccato per longo della stessa bottega, ove si vedonofra le aperture del vestibolo le immense piramide, from Diverse Maniere d'adornare i cammini
description: A compartmentalized scene with several Egyptian figures and caryatids. Upper register depicts a cow in profile, along with birds, a crocodile, a cat, and a hawk. The central register depicts three areas, two of which show figures before a landscape with pyramids and other structures. At the center, two figures hold stelae inscribed with hieroglyphs, with another stela in the center. The lower register contains smaller depictions of figures, some winged, sphinxes, snakes, and other Egyptian characters.

title: Frieze (USA)
description: Two bands of mirror-reversed repeating design composed of a pedestal-like acanthus ornament connected by circular beads to a torch framed by a wreath on a dotted ground bordered on the bottom by two rows of circular beads and a row of circular and oval beads divided by a solid line and on the top by circular beads and horizontal stripes. Printed in white, greens, mica, black, gold and scarlet. Classically  styled design.

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Central metallic gold motif. Above is a group of stylized white roses, printed in a mosaic effect. Background is a striped brown.

title: Print, Horizontal rectangle design: ovoid shapes, cranes and fanciful forms
Cup And Saucer (England)
description: Cup and saucer in white with blue and gold decorative pattern. Saucer appears to have a cylindrical raised foot, where the cup fits into.

title: Chocolate Box And Lid (Germany)
description: Oval lid and body.  Slightly convex lid surmounted by a backward s-shaped vertical handle about nine centimeters long. Oval body narrowing at bottom with curving and descending ramp-like handles on either narrow side.  Both pieces glazed turquoise with highlights of airbrushed brown.  Abstract surface decoration, in the center on the long side of the box, of lines, waves, and patches in airbrished royal blue, brown, and rust.

title: Overton Compote
description: Circular dish on flaring circular foot, the white ground decorated with Japanese-inspired polychrome transfer-printed decoration of sprays of naturalistic flowers with superimposed medallions showing birds in flight or stylized flowers.

title: Print, Allées en gazon pour les Therasse Sableux (Grass Walkways, Sandy Terraces), in Nouveaux Livre de Parterres contenant 24 pensséz diferantes (New Book Containing 24 Different Variations for Garden Beds)
media: etching and engraving on white laid paper
description: Landscape architecture design for garden.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Andromache
description: Partial view of pattern design with red background at top and blue at bottom, each decorated with horizontal lines in black; a light gray line at the top of the design on red ground.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Harlem
description: Pattern of floral motifs in blue, gray and reddish-brown on navy blue ground.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Nuance
description: Geometric pattern of gradiated vertical stripes and chevrons in dark blue on light blue ground.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Alpenveilchen (Cyclamen)
description: Floral motif in coral and pale yellow on jade ground.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Sylvester
description: Checkered pattern, wavy lines, and squares in yellow and shades of gray.

title: Drawing, Garden Recess with Pond and Statue
media: pen and black ink, some scraping, graphite on off-white wove paper
description: In a fountain a figure of a nude woman with raised arms with shawl over head. Beyond fountain, a wall with trees. Cropped view of path leading to the fountain surrounded by grass.

title: Drawing, Design for a Book Cover
description: On greenish ground, round and pointed cartouche, made up of green vines, yellow flowers, yellow hearts at the bottom.

title: Mixing Glass (Ireland)
description: Goblet-shaped, with straight, slightly flaring sides, on a spool stem with central knop, thick flat circular foot, a pouring spout at lip; cut with vertical flutes bottom of sides, above that a band engraved with "CORK CORPORATION" and fine diamonds; ground pontil mark bottom.

title: Drawing, Design for Bed with Tented Alcove, probably for the Prince of Wales's Bedroom or Boudoir, Royal Pavilion, Brighton
media: pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on white wove paper
description: Design for an alcove between two rooms, with a sofa upholstered in a fabric matching the flanking drapery curtains and the tented ceiling canopy.  Above the sofa, the wall is decorated with fluted golden drapery radiating from a convex, sun-shaped mirror.  Drapery frames the sofa recess and doorways.  The walls of the rooms on either side are turquoise.

title: Purse (USA)
description: Knitted bag, circular in form, with an eight-pointed star in the middle with a floral border. Beaded scallops around edges; metal frame, silk lining.

title: Print, Strapwork Grotesque with Mythological Scene
description: Vertical rectangle showing strapwork design. At center, Prometheus on Mount Caucasus. Above, a pair of satyrs holding clusters of fruit. Below, putti with masks and an owl.

title: Wood Engraving. Vignette.
description: Rose wreath.

title: Print, Development du bordure pour le portrait du Roy., Deux coins de la bordure..., 5th Plate, pl. 39 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier
description: Only state. Sheet consisting of four elements of a border: two corners of border decorated with shell and swirling leaf motifs, a large, shell-shaped cartouche at the lower arm of the bottom corner design. Two linear elevations with central cartouches decorated with leaves, the left design showing a suspended chain and lid (?).

title: Tile Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty tiles wide and twenty-three tiles high with opening for fireplace eleven tiles wide and ten high.  Foliage arabesques disposed about three vertical axes from which are emphazised by urns at center and right, and at left by the figure of a standing woman carrying an infant on her arm and accompanied by two children.

title: Tile Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty tiles wide and twenty-three tiles high with opening for fireplace eleven tiles wide and ten high.  Foliage arabesques disposed about three vertical axes from which are emphazised by urns at center and right, and at left by the figure of a standing woman carrying an infant on her arm and accompanied by two children.

title: Wall Facing (Holland), ca. 1725
description:
Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Wall Facing (Holland)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Print, Plate 19 (recto) and plate 20 (verso), Description of the Celebrations Given by the City of Strasbourg, from the series Fêtes de Strasbourg
description:
Plate 19 (recto) within rocaille border topped with coat of arms of France: 25 lines of text, “le Roi, et lui présenterent un Gateau de Païs, orné différentes espéces… Couronnes de Lauriers que les Bergeres et les filles offrirent à Sa Majesté.”

Plate 20 (verso) within rocaille border topped with coat of arms of France: 4 lines of text, “Le Roi partis au son de touter ler Clocher de la Ville,… perdre si-tôt C MONARQUE BIEN-AMIÉ.” Below, a curlicue design separating text from a scene enclosed in another rocaille cartouche. Scene depicts a crowd gathered before a triumphal gate topped with the French coat of arms.
