description: Fragment of Lille style bobbin lace

title: Print, Paysage, Chariot Attelé de Boeufs
media: etching on china paper, laid down
description: Oxen draw a loaded wagon through a meadow. Figures pile bags in the cart, right.

title: Print, Peep-show, Vue des Environs D'ostende
media: engraving in black ink with washes of brown, red, and black watercolors on paper, mounted
description: Peep-show print, after painting

title: Drawing, Panel of Trophies
media: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite on laid paper
description: Vertical rectangle showing design of military trophy.  At center, a shield with a Medusa and crossed quivers. At bottom, a fasces.

title: Drawing (Italy)
media:
pen and black ink with gray wash and traces of graphite
support: thick off-white laid paper

title: Drawing (Italy)
media:
pen and brown ink with gray wash and traces of graphite
support: off-white laid paper

title: Drawing, Italian or Swiss Town
media: brush and oil, pencil on academy board
description: A large church in Italian Gothic style is shown in the center, another church with a two-storied polygonal steeple at the facade  in the left distance. The gate and a corner of a castle are in the right foreground.  Sunshine.

title: Drawing, Colombia or Ecuador, mountains, moonlight
media: brush and oil, pencil on cardboard with gray-brown background
description: View across a valley looking toward a mountain range with cloud capped peaks.  Snow covered peaks are shown in the background.  Full moon.  Grazing cattle and a house are shown in the right foreground.  Bottom margin showing rose grounding color.

title: Drawing, Design for a Woven or Embroidered Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"
media: white chalk, brush and light blue and white gouache on glazed tracing paper
description: A kind of sunflower rises over the hollow of a festoon at left, another flower motif is roughly outlined over the festoon at right.

title: Vase (Austria)
description: Two vases (a,b) in baluster form with gilt decoration in Islamic style.

title: Drawing, Design for Damask Textile
media: brush and gouache on impregnated tracing paper
description: A basket overflowing with flowers, suspended from a ribbon, and adorned with a bow on its side.  Flies, butterflies, and birds enter from the left and lower margins.

title: Drawing, Copy of an escutcheon in one of the fetes publications
media: pen and ink, brush and watercolor on laid paper
description: Framed with and formed in the bottom center by attributes of the sea such as the prow and mast of a ship, a dolphin, a swan, a fishing net, a trident.

title: Drawing, Designs for Two Trophies: Stonecutters and Goldsmiths
media: pen and black ink, brush and wash, black chalk on white laid paper
description: Trophy at left, tools of mason, or stonecutter. Tablet shown with sun shining through clouds. Trophy at right, tools of goldsmiths. Tablet showing liturgical objects and a framed image of the sun, zodiac representations, and a circle drawn by a compass. In the escutcheon below is written: le lapidaire/ et/ l'orfevrerie.

title: Drawing, Design for an Apparatus for Boiling Water
media: pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash on paper
description: Front view. Ovoidal plinth. Two scrolls topped by lion heads hold the body which is shaped as a part of an egg.  The bottom section of the cover is surrounded by a kind of railing; the top section shows cut out quatrefoils.  A tripod censer on top. The spout starts from a mask. Underneath: a receptacle for spirits consisting of an egg shape and the foreparts of crouching dragons.

title: Drawing, Elevation of a Mantlepiece Wall
media: pen and black ink, brush and yellow, rose and grey wash
description: A looking glass is in the over mantel. Putti form bases of candelabra on mantle shelf. Flanking mantle are two women carrying baskets on their heads, medallions above, defined by fluted pilasters. In niches on either side are putti playing in shell-shaped fountains.

title: Drawing, Design for a Frontispiece
media: pen and black ink, brush and black ink wash on paper
description: In the scheme of an entablature and a pediment. Putti decorate an escutcheon with a device. An obelisk is depicted with a garland wound around it. Two stairs are shown as well. Depicts coat of arms of architect Carl Harlernan, friend of Meissonnier.

title: Panel (France)
media: silk embroidered with metal thread and sequins on silk
description: Fragment of panel of pale blue silk grosgrain with border embroidered in gold metal thread and sequins in design of stiff symmetrical flower sprays connected by a linked chain.  Gold ribbon on three edges. Lined with white linen embroidered in cotton cross-stitch, lining probably part of a skirt originally.

title: Drawing, Designs for Embroidered or Woven Floral Motifs of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf," Finished and Unfinished
media: incised lines, brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper pasted on paper
description: Top row: two plants, upside down, and a pointed ovoid, incised lines, two bell flower boughs, finished. Bottom row: a blossom and a row of flower sprays obliquely shown over a row of leaves and scallops, incised lines.

title: Drawing, Design for an Embroidered or Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"
media: brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper
description: A fantastical plant stands over three lace flowers and a scalloped edge. Somewhat more than two repeats are shown.

title: Print, Almanac for 1789
media: engraving, brush and watercolor on paper
description: Calendar for second half-year, with three scènes galantes; harvest, vintage, sledge party.

title: Print, Design for a Candlestick, plate 74, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)
description: Candlestick on platform; twisted from bottom up with vegetal forms; a crown-like object sits at center.

title: Print, Projet du Sallon de la Princesse Sartorinski en Pologne (Project for the Salon of the Princess Czartoryski in Poland), plate 84, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)
description: Symmetrical view of interior decoration of salon with five double windows, each with ornamented overhanging. From left: three putti in rocaille frame with central putto's arms raised holding crown, against background of wheat; second from left: group of ladies sitting in a trompe l'oeil balcony as though at the theater; central overhanging: two classical female figures flank empty crowned cartouche; right of center: three formally dressed ladies in trompe l'oeil balcony; far right: three putti with large amphora.

title: Drawing, Spartan Virtue
media: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
description: Young man in armor shown receiving shield from woman seated in armory. Staircase connects room with big hall. Framed by pencil square, whose lines divided into six parts.

title: Drawing, Continence of Scipio
media: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
description: Sitting at left in his tent, he dismisses Spanish girl and her fiancé Allucius, who had been held hostages at Carthage. Marching Roman soldiers shown in background.

title: Drawing, Stories of Jove, 1803
media: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper

title: Print, Figural Letter, Capital A from a Story of Louis XIV of France
description: Shown against a representation of the king addressing officers in a camp before a town. Moulded frame.

title: Drawing, One of Sixteen Scenes of the Death and Burial of a Man
media: japan watercolor on silk or paper
description: From a series of sixteen scenes of the death and burial of a man in Japan.

title: Drawing, One of Sixteen Scenes of the Death and Burial of a Man
media: japan watercolor on silk or paper
description: From a series of sixteen scenes of the death and burial of a man in Japan.

title: Cap (Spain)
description: Cap of coral silk with a chenille tassel in the same color. Knit with altnernating bands in a simple goemetric patterns.

title: Print, The Entombment, from The Little Passion Series
description: The body of Christ is placed in the tomb, in the foreground. The Marys and Saint John are behind the tomb, at left, the Virgin standing with Saint John. Monogram of Dürer, lower left.

title: Coverlet (USA)
description: Large complete coverlet in navy blue wool and white cotton with two central wreaths enclosing an eight-pointed star. Surrounding these are an array of floral and bird motifs including eagles with wings spread and clutching banners, scrolling acanthus leaves, a small building with cupola, and pairs of reindeer. Date on coverlet appears to read 1855.

title: Textile, The Twin Rose
description: Printed textile showing pattern of yellow stylized roses and green leaves on a green-grey ground with vertical black stripes.

title: Sketchbook Folio, Seascape with Beach and Sun Breaking through Clouds
description: View from beach of waves coming up on shore, at an angle from right foreground towards left background, with dark sky.

title: Sketchbook Folio, Serene View of Ocean and Beach
description: View from beach of waves breaking on shore.

title: Border (France)
description: Undulating length of lavender moire ribbon with parallel white stripes of two widths. Bows or gathers, bound transversely by twisted cords, occur at intervals. White portions are shaded with gray. Printed on white ground.

title: Cup And Saucer
media: soft-paste porcelain with transfer-printed underglaze cobalt decoration
description: Outcurving side with cylindrical foot, with curved side. Decoration of floral sprays and butterflies.

title: Ribbon Samples (France)
description: Four samples of wide ribbon, each with a black satin ground and a design in gold and one other color. Motif of concentric circles contains swirling wing-like clusters.

title: Mount (probably Italy)
media: gilt and coppered bronze with pewter or lead surround
description: Winged cupid playing a lute riding a lion.

title: Print, Waterfall of Maples (Momiji no Taki), No. 34
description: A large iris, outer perianth leaves violet; inner leaves white with deep magenta tips.

title: Cravat End (Belgium)
description: Cravat end of Mechlin with a central cartouche filled by a bowl of flowers and surrounded by floral and foliated branches interspersed by volutes, terminating in scrolls.

title: Cap Streamer (Belgium)
description: Binche-style lace design composed of symmetric pattern of foliated and floral forms, set within medallions of varying shapes, connected by serpentine garlands outlining medallions.

title: Barometer (France)
description: Barometer, with separte piece from the bottom of casing in box.

title: Pleated Fan, ca. 1860
media: paper leaf with hand-colored lithograph, pierced, carved and gilded mother-of-pearl sticks, rivet set with a faceted stone, gilt metal bail
description: Pleated fan. Leaf of paper with hand-colored lithograph. Obverse: three classical figure groups in landscape. Reverse: smaller scale single landscape with distant buildings and figures. Pierced, carved and gilded mother-of-pearl sticks wide enough to form uninterrupted mass of decoration at gorge when open. Rivet is set with a faceted stone. Gilt metal bail.

title: Textile
description: Large uneven fragment of cotton with elaborately roller printed ground, in wave pattern, foliage clusters and long scrolling leaf crossing design, in lighter gray and over printed with clusters of natural size roses in yellow and sepia.

title: Print, Landscape with Castle and Lake
description: Horizontal rectangle.  A rocky bluff is surmounted by a fortress, center.  At right, a castle at the edge of a body of water.  Framing line.

title: Print, Femme dressée sur un piédestal orné de bas-reliefs (Woman Standing on a Pedestal Decorated with Bas-Reliefs)
description: A nude female standing atop a vase that is decorated with figures, among other classical objects, surrounded by dark foliage. In the background, a classical Parthenon-style building.

title: Fruit Plate
description: Flat marly springing from scalloped inner rim. Raised, feathered edge, painted brown and green. In center, large and small cucumber and an apple. On marly, three rose hips, a purple long radish, currents and small red berries.

title: Sidewall (probably USA)
description: Scrollwork enframing landscape with stag and mountains, printed in grisaille on gray ground.

title: Textile (Japan)
description: Length of stencil resist (katazome) in ivory pattern with red details on finely dotted blue ground. Two rows of large (12 cm) full-faced flowers with leaves and tendrils.

title: Drawing, Design for Advertisement: N'Aimez Que Moi by Parfums Caron, Paris
media: brush and blue, pink and yellow gouache, brush and ink, graphite on off-white wove paper
description: Design for advertisement for Parfums Caron’s fragrance N’Aimez Que Moi. Vertical format with bold, irregular black ink border in which abstract shapes and florals in pastel tones interplay. In black ink at lower right, cursive inscription “parfums Caron / Paris” and in bold, sans-serif majuscules “N’AIMEZ / QUE MOI” lettered below.

title: Cadbury's Cocoa Matchsafe
description: Cadbury's Cocoa/Absolutely Pure Therefore Best

title: Frieze (USA)
description: On light gray ground, beige and light brown flowers in allover pattern in two registers.

title: Frieze (USA)
description: A repeating design of an arbor of swags of blue roses, connected by light gray leaves with blue rosebuds. Printed in shades of blue, green, gray and ivory on an ivory ground between green borders.

title: Coverlet (USA)
description: Summer and Winter-style coverlet has a star and flower pattern covering the central field with a rose border. Colors are red and white. Woven inscription reads: "Made by H. Haeseler, Orwigsburg, Property of -----, 1848."

title: Palampore (India)
description:
From a large mound, painted in shades of red, brown and black, rises a cluster of eight bamboos, which branch toward the sides and top.  Bamboos are twined with vines bearing flowers. From the corners of mound grow flowering trees in branches of which parakeets and squirrels disport themselves. The bamboo trunks are alternately red and brown. Most of flowers in shades of red except for a few large blossoms which are white, with veins of black, but tree trunks at sides are brown and foliage yellow-ish brown with dark brown veins. In upper branches, several large birds in black and brown, identified as babblers, and the parakeets are red, with tails in light and dark brown. In the mound, which is painted in detail in conventionalized paints and curves to suggest hillocks, ar eseveral large blossoms in red, one in browns, and groups of animals (deer?) in red.
The entire background is painted with a minute feathery pattern of foliage in a light yellowish-brown.  
A border, 17 1/2 inches wide, in formal design of flower garlands and ribbons, edges the entire quilt, except lower corners, left and right, where it has been cut away to fit a bed. Originally the border was painted in one with the main design, as seen at the bottom, but the cover has been shortened at top, thus clipping off the tips of the bamboos, and cut into at the sides. Where these alterations have taken place the border is sewn by hand to the body of the quilt.
Colors: two reds, dark and light brown, pale yellow-brown; remains of light blue in a few large flowers and a few border flowers, black.

title: Vase
description: Opaline glass, enamel decoration. In yellow and amber

title: Textile (England)
description: Narrow stripes with architectural objects, plants and ornament filling the space betwen the stripes. In red on white.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Delft
description: On white ground, stylized branching blue flower forms outlined in black, with petals and leaves highlighted in contrasting white.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Hexe (Witch)
description: Black, light purple, silver, pink, and light blue straight and stepped lines traverse a green ground.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Bergfex
description: Partial view of pattern design with layered diagonal stripes in shades of blue and gray.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Abisag
description: Partial blossoms in pink and cream with black stems on gray ground.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Daphne
description: Thin sprigs with large elongated leaves in pink and blue on white ground.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Marina
description: Wave pattern in pinks, purples, and white.

title: Sampler
description: Initials "A.M." and the word "Le Temps" with a representation of time surrounded by a floral border with cornucopia and musical instruments at corners. Edges unfinished.

title: Print, Plate 1, from Die Folge der phantastichen Scmucksträße (Suite of Fantastic Ornamental Bouquets)
description: Octagonal print showing a nosegay plant; two grotesque head-monsters flank the bottom of the plant; symmetrical arabesque motif with creatures.

title: Uncut Waistcoat (France)
description: Design of rayed circles alternating with diamonds having rays at two points, set between horizontal lines turning at right angles.  Parts are indicated for waistcoat fronts, reveres, collar, pocket flaps, and buttons.

title: Fragment (England)
description: Pastoral scene in sepia on white ground. Upper left corner, a couple fishes; upper right, a field with gleaners; the central scene, children and adults picking fruit.

title: Textile (USA)
description: White fabric printed in blue with a design of a man seated on a flying eagle with the inscription "To Philadelphia." Background has a scrolling vine pattern. Made to commemorate the Philadelphia Centennial in 1876.

title: Drawing, Triumphal Arch on an Ideal Piazza
media: pen and black ink, brush and blue, green and yellow watercolor on cardboard
description: View of a triumphal arch placed on a piazza.  At the foreground stands a triumphal arch with one archway, four columns with Corinthian capitals, two reliefs, and two medallions.  It stands on a marble pavement.  In the middle distance, inscribed by the opening of the triumphal arch stands an obelisk.  Behind the arch and on either side of the obelisk are low, one story buildings with large arched niches and small round niches.  In the facades facing the front, the niches are occupied by figurative statues.

title: Drawing, Design for Setting Consecration of Antique Temple
media: pen and sepia ink, brush and wash on paper
description: Horizontal rectangle. Crowd of figures in antique temple hall at twilight, light from hanging braziers in temple at right.

title: Print, The Flagellation
description: Two men scourge the Lord; a priest watches.

title: Print, Simon Carrying the Cross
description: He is preceded by the Lord who is driven by a soldier.

title: Sample Book Of Embroidery Trimmings (possibly Switzerland)
description: Ledger containing samples of machine embroidered trimmings.

title: Sidewall (possibly USA)
description: Original document for "Sawtooth Chain."  Floral zig-zag pattern.  Printed in red, pink and white, on a tan or yellow ground.

title: Drawing, The Red Room, Schloss Fischbach
media: brush and watercolor, graphite on white wove paper
description: Displaying a combination of Neo-Gothic and Jacobean styles, this red room reflects the influence of Karl-Friedrich Schinkel's design books that were available from the 1820's onward. Chairs, cabinets-on-stand, tables and a harpsichord are late Renaissance in style. Chandeliers are Neo-Gothic in the manner of A. W. Pugin. The upper panes of the windows are inset with heraldic motifs, and tasselled pelmets create a valance across the top. A central medallion and floral-and-leaf pattern comprise a carpet in the Neo-Classical style.

title: Tile Wall Facing (Holland)
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty tiles wide and twenty-three tiles high with opening for fireplace eleven tiles wide and ten high.  Foliage arabesques disposed about three vertical axes from which are emphazised by urns at center and right, and at left by the figure of a standing woman carrying an infant on her arm and accompanied by two children.

title: Wall Facing (Holland)
description:
Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Drawing, Wall Elevation Design for Bedroom or Dressing Room
Traveling Eating Set (Scandanavia or Germany)
description: Folding knife with one large and two smaller blades, upper edge decorated with engraved inlaid brass. Large brass oval spoon bowl with pointed tip, engraved floral decoration on the back of spoon. Steel fork has four straight tines, heart-shaped openings on the joint and neck of the fork. Brass handle, inlaid with mother-of-pearl squares on front and back. Four brass rivets on each piece of mother-of-pearl.

title: Knife (France), 19th century
description: Straight-sided blade with a rounded point. Plain baluster, brass (?) ferrule, round in section. White pistol-shaped handle with pink flower sprays and green wreath of leaves close to the ferrule.

title: Fragment, late 17th century
description: Bobbin-made tape, buttonholed along edges, forms outlines for scrolling symmetrical floral design. Details filled in with needle lace stitches and connecting picoted bars. Sometimes referred to as mezzo punto.

title: Fragment
description: Fragment of lace made of continuous tape bobbin lace with Valencienne like braided ground.

title: Fragment
description: Fragment of Lille style bobbin lace.

title: Birdcage (Italy)
media: glass, silver-plated metal, metal, gilt wood
description: Table type circular dome shape cage of glass, with frame of Sheffield plate. Concealed door. Wood base has two brass pins (b,c) for supporting floor (d). (e) and (f) are blue glass food containers and (g) is tassel of red silk and gold braid.

title: Candlestick (USA)
description: Two-tiered square base with two rows of beading, of silver. Blue glass column shaft, capped by silver capital hung with three bead swags. Candleholder  in the shape of a fluted urn, silver. No marks.

title: Print, Mt. Kyodai (Kyodaisan), No. 44
description: A large iris, outer perianth leaves deep purple to light blue at center; inner leaves white with purple tips.

title: Fragment (Italy)

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Stakete [Stakette]

title: Vase Vase
media: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold, metal

title: Textile (England)
description: 48 Swatches of printed fabric (24 per side of page) each about 5.5 x 8 cm. (2 1/8" x 3 1/8") each numbered in pen and ink from 1241 through 1288. Small scale floral, geometric and fine stripped patterns in one to three colors. Ten samples of the "Lapis" technique. Yellow over blue for green. Page is double-sided

title: Fragment (Italy)
description: Fragment of a large scale ogee patterned velvet with three colors. The pattern is created by blue cut pile with details in red and white cut pile. The background consisting of a linear pattern is voided. The pile is cut to one height over the entire surface.

title: Skirt (China)
description: Blue silk satin skirt embroidered in colored silks with a design of flowers and birds; trimmed with black satin bands and black silk braid. Waistband of white linen lined with pink silk woven with a fret pattern. The skirt is made in two parts designed to wrap around the body, with straight panels in the front and back and pleated sections at each side.

title: Printing Block (USA)

title: Border (France)

description: Vertical rectangle depicting an angel that holds a torch in his right hand, and rests his left hand on a shield bearing the inscription: "THOM. J. POST AT REST AFTER A LONG LIFE OF INDUSTRY THRIFT AND SOBRIETY".

title: Print, Cloisonnée (Shippo), No. 17
description: A large iris, outer perianth leaves in varying shades of light blue; inner leaves in light purple with deep purple tips.

title: Gourd Vase Vase
description: Gourd-shaped vase of dark buff clay, decorated in the “bleu-persan” style, with very loose white decoration on a cobalt glue ground. Sponging at top.

title: Border (France)
description: Small-scale floral allover pattern forming cartouches.

title: Sidewall, Country Life
description: On an ungrounded, light-weight gray paper are printed picture frames (tromp l'oeil) in horizontal, alternating rows. Each frame contains horse-back riders in red, green, brown, gray and blue.

title: Arm Band (USA)
description: Arm band of hide, beaded in a geometric pattern of white, black and orange on blue.

title: Drawing, View of Naples (or vicinity)
description: A Neapolitan landscape showing the view from Carmine of the Mediterranean Sea near Naples (caption reads Napoli dal Carmine, or Naples from Carmine). Buildings along a curved beach, with a hill in the right backgroud, several figures in the right foreground, and ships on the water.

title: Border (France)
description:
Narrow border with egg and leaf pattern. A blue band runs below, enclosing voided circle with red pin dots. Below this, a solid red band, followed by white beading. Printed on ungrounded tan paper.

H#143

title: Textile (England)
description: One of seven pages from a printed fabric sample book has a bright purple ground with horizontal garlands of plaid ribbon and bunches of pink roses and small orange flowers.

title: Drawing, Designs for Souvenir Fans for the 1867 Paris Exposition Universelle
media: transparent watercolor and white gouache, graphite indicating fan shape on white wove paper
description:
Fan design consisting of 3 images:
At left: Classical bust, right profile of a woman, terracotta ground, octagonal shape
Center: Dancing young Bacchus holding a tambourine in left hand and a spear in right hand on green ground, twig and leaf border encircled by blue ribbon, bows at either side, circular shape. Inscribed on ribbon, bottom center, pen and black ink, À Paris Exposition Universel de 1867
At right: classical bust, left profile of a woman, terracotta ground, octagonal shape

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Daphne
description: Thin sprigs with large elongated leaves in blue and brown on white ground.

title: Robe (China)
description: Robe closing diagonally across the shoulder and under the right arm. Made of dark purple silk in gauze weave with medallions of dragons and floral designs. Trimmed with a wide black silk band embroidered in shades of blue with flowers, butterflies, and auspicious symbols; and a narrow green band woven with floral designs. Fastenings are four silk frogs with four spherical brass buttons.

title: Handkerchief (Switzerland)
description: Square handkerchief with a field of paisley shapes facing in alternating directions and a floral border. In black, white, red, and yellow on a turquoise blue ground.

title: Poster, The Ships are Coming
description: An eagle takes up a large portion of the top half of the poster. The eagle is mid flight but appears to be reacting to something because its claws are in a defensive position. The eagle is flying over a shipping yard, with a city in the background. A red sun appears at the horizon. Text at bottom: THE SHIPS ARE COMING / United States Shipping Board Emergency Fleet Corporation .

title: Printing Block (England)
description: One from a set of five blocks for printing fabric. This presumably would have been the third in the series to have been printed.

title: Printing Block (England)
description: One from a set of five blocks for printing textiles. This would have been the second block in the sequence of printing.

title: Print, Lettre sur les Eléments de la gravure á l'Eauforte (Letter on the elements of etching), Page 3
description: One of five sheets on the techniques of etching with illustrations of various processes involved, as vignettes.

title: Drawing, Strapwork Design with Landscape
media: charcoal, pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper
description: Strapwork with harpies and cornucopia frame a landscape with a house on a hill.

title: Drawing (Italy)
media:
pen and brown ink with gray wash and traces of graphite
support: off-white laid paper

title: Fragments
description:
fragments from a chasuble.
Palmette shapes within checkerboard strapwork in green.

title: Drawing, Port Neuf Canyon, Idaho
media: brush and watercolor over graphite, ruled in graphite on off-white laid paper
description: Horizontal view of a large body of water in foreground and mountain ranges in the background.

title: Drawing, Autumn Landscape in New England
media: brush and oil paint on paperboard
description: A range of hills extends to the left from the right foreground. Behind, a lake is shown. Mountains in background at top.

title: Drawing, Design for an Embroidered or Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"
media: brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper
description: Bough with halves of leaves form a pointed crest border. Three calyces rise over a rosette in the hollows. Four and the greater part of a fifth repeat are shown.

title: Print, Illustration for "Oeuvres de Salomon Gessner"
description: Illustration for "Oeuvres de Salomon Gessner"

title: Print, Design for Pulpit, ca. 1670
description: Verso: blotted black crayon sketch: segments.

title: Print, Hommage Champètre (Pastorale), from Nouveaux morceaux pour des Paravants (New Designs for Screens)
media: etching and engraving on white laid paper
description: Vertical panel design with a pagoda motif, top center, an architectural ruin showing the capital of a column, an urn, a broken column, interspersed with garlands and leaves. In the central scene a young man is about to lay a wreath of flowers upon the head of a young woman who is reclining amongst bushes, leaves, and branches. Two putti appear below.

title: Print, Arrival and Descent of King Louis XV in front of the Main Portal of the Cathedral Church of Strasbourg, no. 4 from the series Fêtes de Strasbourg
description: Scene showing the greeting of Louis VX by the cardinal de Rohan at the door the the cathedral, the king's carriage leaving to the right. Cathedral, with rose window and gothic portals stands high above a large crowd. On both sides the houses are decorated at groundfloor level with tapestries.

title: Print, Development de bordures du Portrait du Roy, Cartouche aux armes du roi..., 4th plate, pl. 38 in Oeuvre de Juste-Aurele Meissonnier
description: Only state. Asymmetrical border with center cartouche with the arms of the king, three fleurs de lis, a crown at the top, a putto at left. Border decorated with swirling leaves and garlands.

title: Print, Vue des trumeaux du même Cabinet; Vue des trumeaux du même Cabinet, 3rd Plate
description: Detail of Count Bielinski's cabinet (1921-6-212-45). Elevation showing a reflecting pier mirror with a wall-mounted console table below. To the left, a scene of steps, tall pillars, a large urn and leafy trees is seen through the window. To the right, a tall boiserie panel decorated at the center with a winged angel blowing a horn.

title: Print, Projet d'un Plafond de Peinture pour la Chapelle de la Vierge de St. Sulpice de Paris (Design for Painted Ceiling for the Chapel of the Virgin of St. Sulpice of Paris), plate 105, in Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)
description: Ceiling, with trompe l'oeil effect, depicting Virgin gazing skyward with sun and rays behind and arms extended, surrounded by winged figures and putti playing musical instruments.

title: Drawing, A Sauce Boat
media: pen and ink, brush and wash on paper
description: Side view; boat supported by a globe and a turtle. The handle consists of two horns of a satyr mask. Spout is turned left.

title: Drawing, A pair of trophies referring to the crafts of the cabinet maker and the carpenter
media: pen and black ink, brush and gray was with black chalk on laid paper
description: At left: Tools and a drawing book and ovoidal relief showing a beaver gnawing a pole, suspended from a windlass. At right: tools, drawings, a framed representation of a compass, a carpenter's rule, a snake; suspended from a ribbon.

title: Drawing, Field Kitchen Fire
media: graphite on cream wove paper, laid down
description: Horizontal view of a field kitchen fire.

title: Drawing, Design for an Embroidered or Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"
media: brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper
description: Flower boughs, of which somewhat less than three are shown, are obliquely disposed over a row of hanging flower boughs.

title: Print, Pot à Sucre (Sugar Bowl) and Sallière à deux (Double Salt Cellar), plate 53, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part
description: Two objects: lower, double bowl made by large shells with lids, an X above a shield with stars and crown divides the bowls. Above, tureen with gourd-like appearance with shell-shaped lid and finial made of flowers. Foot is a shell.

title: Drawing (Italy)
media: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over cream laid paper

title: Pastel, Landscape
description: Distant view across a lake of the sea at sunset. A wooden island is shown in the left middle distance. High cloudy sky with a few patches of blue.

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Complete width. Ground ribbed horizontally, design raised with vertical cross-hatchings. Design contains numerous neo-classical motifs including an oval medallion containing draped fabric with tassels, a bracket supports two doves facing a pedestal or altar with flames. Draped fabric or lambrequin with tassels suspended from medallion. Motifs of acanthus foliage sprouting what appears to be wheat. Pomegranates appear in foliage above medallion. Printed in solid metallic gold on stamped paper.

title: Earrings (India)
description: Pair of earrings. Turquoise matrix and silver.

title: Square, Playing at Soldiers
description: Small square of cream colored cotton, printed, copperplate, in red.  Three scenes: center, in oval – boys in a schoolyard "Playing at Soldiers [inscription above].  At top, boys with bows and arrows, shooting the target; inscription above "Shrove Tide."  Bottom, group of boys and older people on shore, with sticks and swords, looking at battle at sea between two sailing ships.  Inscription: "Prepared for Invasion."

title: Decorative Door Boss And Nail
description: Flat, square mount with square molded element rising at center and paired radiating lines. Each quadrant of design has a projecting cusp and four barbs forming a leaf-like pattern. Grooved nail heads on a square shank.

title: Decorative Door Boss And Nail
description: Square type, pierced and embossed with wrought lines. Quadrant leaf design based on old examples. Round nail head on square shank.

title: Drawing, Keats' Home in Rome
media: pen and brush and black ink, graphite on off-white wove paper
description: Illustration depicting the view across the fountain of the Piazza della Trinità dei Monti, Rome, and showing the Spanish Steps. At right, the house where Keats died. Framing lines in graphite.

title: Print, Head of a Man on a Pyre at the Feet of a Magician and His Companions, plate 4 from the Scherzi di Fantasia
description: An old magician supported by a young man, and a seated man in front of him watching a head burning. In the background several men and a sarcophagus.

title: Print, Le Grand Seigneur (The Nobleman), plate 17 from the series Caravanne du Sultan à la Mecque (The Sultan's Caravan to Mecca)
description: Bearded man in Turkish costume stands on porch with railing and landscape beyond, facing slightly left. His right hand rests at hip; in his left, he holds staff, with crescent moon on top. Crescent moon and feathers decorate his high stiff hat, and loops of pearl, his belt.

title: Photostat, Advertisement for a Megalethoscope, Invented by Charles Ponti
description: The advertisement is titled, Mégaléthoscope de Charles Ponti, with a picture below, and each part lettered. Above and below, faces of a medal awarded by the London Exposition in 1862 to the inventor, Charles Ponti. Above, a description and key in English.

title: Cap Crown (France)
description: Cap crown with a design of large conventionalized leaves, flowers and floral clusters surrounding a central heart-shaped motif.

title: Band, 16th century
media: silk of many colors, gold metallic foil wound onto yellow silk, silver metallic foil wound onto white silk
description: Border of gold metallic lace with colored silks in a pattern of floral and foliated forms and animal images. Gold is wound around a linen core to create a metallic thread.

title: Medal (USA)
description: medal commemorating Daniel Webster

title: Sketchbook Folio, Dark Ocean under Dramatic Sky with Possible Shipwreck Debris
media: pen and black ink on off-white wove paper
description: Very dramatic, cloudy sky over flat ocean coming onto shore. Dark objects on beach in bottom left, possibly shipwreck debris.

title: Sketchbook Folio, Rocky Coast and Distant Cliffs
media: pen and black ink on off-white wove paper
description: Waves crashing against rocks in right foreground. Second rocky outcropping in left middle ground. Cliffs across horizon in distance.

title: Sketchbook Folio, Serene Seascape with Small Waves
media: pen and black ink on off-white wove paper
description: Beach in left foreground with small, calm waves coming onto shore.

title: Tile (England)
description: Square tile of reddish buff clay with grog added. Brilliant greenish blue colored glaze, crazed. Stamped with double wing on back, surrounded by "W. De Morgan 2 Co Sand's End Pottery"

title: Textile (Northern France), 1823
description: Panel, cotton, copper plate printed, Toile de Jouy, in purple, showing scenes from the Histoire de Balisaire, signed by Philippe Wyngaert.

title: Bag (Mexico)
description: Woven bag that depicts rows of animals on one side. The other has a diamond shape with enclosed stars. Shoulder band in plain weave.

title: Print, The Wreck of the "Atlantic" – Cast up by the Sea
media: wood engraving printed in black ink on paper
description: Horizontal view of rocky seacoast with boulders, with the figure of a woman in nightdress lying full length in the foreground, while beyond her, looking downward, is a man with a boathook, and in distance, at right, are a point of land with figures and foundered steamship.

title: Drawing, Wallpaper Design
media: brush and gouache, graphite on white paper
description: A dado is shown at the bottom. On top are a frieze with two intertwined waved garlands of different designs and an entablature. The panel is decorated with stylized trees, the colors of which alternate between green and white, on a lilac background.

title: Scenic, Chinese Chippendale, ca. 1850
description: Portion of a palace with triple roof. In foreground, man, dressed in blue and pink, seated on stool next to paved walkway. Width numbered 28 at bottom.

title: Scenic, Chinese Chippendale
description: Portion of a palace and adjoining wall. In foreground, standing man with a bow, and portion of a stream. Width numbered 29 at bottom.

title: Band (Italy)
description: Pieced-together elements from a needle-lace floral vine border, with a delicate picot along the top edge.

title: Sidewall (USA), 1905–1915
description: Band of stems with blue three-flower (poppy) bouquets alternating with thinner monochrome (white) bands of daisy-like flowers. Backgournd is a small white grid. Printed in blues, greens and white on ungrounded paper.

title: Frieze (USA)
description: Circular tri-lobed motifs containing anthemion with c-scrolls alternating with circular motifs over lined square borders. Printed in beige, tan, and white on beige ground.

title: Frieze (USA)
description: Small and large green and dark red anthemions, outlined with c-scrolls in pink, on beige ground.

title: Drawing, View of Naples (or vicinity)
description: View of the islet Nisida near Naples from the mainland. Boats in the surrounding water and several figures on the Neapolitan shore.

title: Fragment (Italy)
description: Cutwork fragment, no wrapping or embroidery.

title: Band (Italy)
description: Band of curving vines radiate from a symmetrical central vase and flower arrangement.

title: Corner Fragment (Belgium)
description: Fragment of Brussels-style lace.

title: Band (probably Russia)
description: Band of lace worked in a provincial style with a pattern of geometric star shapes.

title: Candy Dish (USA)
description: Tall footed candy dish.  Slight yellow glass foot, blue-green dish.

title: Drawing, Petit Jardin Close (Ground Plan for a House and Small Enclosed Garden)
media: pen and black ink, brush and black wash, graphite on cream wove paper
description: A narrow rectangular pavement and parterres at bottom, above which a large rectangle marked “Maison” is placed within a black square area. Above house a narrow and deep sunken parterre with a gallery to the right and left. Shallow stairs lead to a raised terrace with a paved horizontal oval area in the middle.

title: Drawing, Kerstmis
media:
pen
support: wove blue paper (faded to brown)

title: Doily, Flora's Retinue: Lily
description: Small square doily, fringed on all sides, with an ivory linen warp and violet silk weft. A figure of a woman dressed as a lily and holding a large lily, with the word LILY in the upper right corner, all in ivory on a violet ground. A set of six, the doilies would have been used on the table as part of a dessert service.

title: Bedcover
description: Cover made of several lengths and smaller pieces of fabric. Fabric arranged so that the part of the cover that falls over the sides is at right angles to the fabric in the center. Seams are trimmed with woven tape. Design is of animals hunting animals; a pack of dogs attacking a cornered wolf, a pack of dogs attacking a stag, a whippet killing quail, a fox attacking a rooster while hen and chicks flee, a dog attacking a nesting goose, a fox with a foot caught in a snare and a hunting dog next to a gun standing guard over a dead rabbit and birds.

title: Tray (USA), ca. 1915
description: Octagonal tray with upraised rim decorated with Japanesque motifs.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Cook
description: On pink ground, partial view of pattern design with a grid composed of dark pink and blue-gray lines; groups of elliptical ovals at various intersections throughout.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Quadern (Ashlars)
media: brush and gouache, graphite on paper
description: Repeating diamond shapes with leaf motif in middle and pink and rose flower in between on turquoise and green background.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Bergfex
description: Partial view of pattern design with layered chevron stripes in shades of green, blue, and brown.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Soana
description: White ground with blue rectilinear line pattern of squares, rectangles, and stylized blossoms

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Diskus (Discus)
description: Alternating red-brown and white ground with white flowers highlighted in yellow and pink on white and dark brown stylized zigzag vines

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Prolog (Prologue)
description: Pattern of alternating blue and gray squares, separated by vertical pink and black lines, with parts of lines in blue and red.

title: Airplane Plate
description: Circular, with notched gilded border and in the center a scene showing a stylized airplane flown by a young man and woman, a red flying carpet, a couple dressed in medieval costume, a chained ogre, caged birds

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Band of stylized flowers alternating with stripes and circles.  Floral bouquet in void.  Printed in two shades of green, blue and gray on an off-white ground.

title: Album Page, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Album Page, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again, 1901
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Album Page, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again, 1901
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Album Page, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again, 1901
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Album Page, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again, 1901
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Album Page, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again, 1901
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Album Page, Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again, 1901
media: newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering
description: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty-seven tiles wide and twenty-one high with opening for door or window nineteen and one-half tiles high and twelve wide.  To left and right of opening, centered canopy above. Left, woman representing Hope, right, a sculputure urn.  Centered above opening, a mascaron.  Arabesque design of foliage.

title: Wall Facing (Holland), ca. 1725
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty-seven tiles wide and twenty-one high with opening for door or window nineteen and one-half tiles high and twelve wide.  To left and right of opening, centered canopy above. Left, woman representing Hope, right, a sculputure urn.  Centered above opening, a mascaron.  Arabesque design of foliage.

title: Tile Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Thirty tiles wide and twenty-three tiles high with opening for fireplace eleven tiles wide and ten high.  Foliage arabesques disposed about three vertical axes from which are emphazised by urns at center and right, and at left by the figure of a standing woman carrying an infant on her arm and accompanied by two children.

title: Wall Facing (Holland)
description:
Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Wall Facing (Holland)
description:
Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Wall Facing (Holland)
description:
Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Plate Plate
media: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold
description: Circular form with scalloped edge and shallow well; wide rim glazed light blue, molded with five floral sprigs and scalloped edge, reserved in white; edge picked out in gilding; in center, a polychrome bouquet encircled by gilded vine motif, all on white ground.

title: Plate Plate
media: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold
description: Circular form with scalloped edge and shallow well; wide rim glazed light blue, molded with five floral sprigs and scalloped edge, reserved in white; edge picked out in gilding; in center, a polychrome bouquet encircled by gilded vine motif, all on white ground.

title: Mirror
description: Rectangular mirror with shaped, open-work brass frame. Easle-type support on reverse.

title: Sample Book, Fabbriche Italiane di Seterie, Como, Serie D Vol. III DAL 1854 AL  2 Lats Noir
media: label: leather binding, paper pages, jacquard woven silk samples
description: Sample book of jacquard woven silk samples, separated by transparent paper sheets, bound in leather. Samples primarily with black grounds and brilliantly colored designs.

title: Fragment
description: Incomplete design of decorative leaves, crown and palmette in metallic gold on green background.

title: Fragment, 19th century
description: Fragment of Lille type bobbin lace

title: Fragment
description:
Fragment of Brussels type bobbin lace. Made with both needle and bobbin made ground.
18th c, Northern Europe

title: Drawing, Palm Trees, Jamaica
media: brush and oil paint on cardboard
description: Vertical image of a group of two palm trees growing beside a hillside.

title: Tile (Iran)
description: Vertical rectangle. Turbaned figure on white horse directed toward the left, holds white falcon in right hand. Floral ornament at edges. Heavily glazed, the figures penciled in black and standing in relief against blue ground.

title: Brisé Fan
media: pierced and painted ivory sticks; engraved paper medallions
description: Brisé fan of ivory, obverse decorated with three colored engravings on paper in the style of Angelica Kauffmann (Swiss painter and printmaker, 1741-1807). In center, a pair of cupids; to right, Venus dispatches Cupid; to left, Venus decorating Cupid with flowers on his return. Sticks pierced, painted in gouache with garlands of flowers.

title: Print, The Feather of a Big Bird (Otorige), No. 27
description: A large iris, outer perianth leaves purple; inner leaves magenta and purple.

title: Textile (France)
description: Heavyweight silk with horizontal ribbing has a multicolored design of small-scale sprays of roses and other flowers on a dark purple ground. Both selvedges present.

title: Border (Italy)
description: Border of serpentine floral sprays outlined by cordonnet. Pattern connected by brides picotées, outlined by cordonnet and interspersed by portes and gaze quadrillée.

title: Border (possibly Belgium)
description: Small scale floral and geometric shapes set within repeat grouping of four pendants.

title: Frieze (France)
description: Dado pattern of five brightly-colored horizontal bandings. Bottom to top: 1) narrow gold and brown geometric architectural border; 2) gray diamonds; 3) principal banding - pale blue marbleized ground with black decorative circles around yellow and brown winged cupids playing with butterflies. Foliage and palmette ornament, black lyre; 4)banding of bright marbleized green with gold and brown bosses, circles, and black palmettes; 5) black simplified acanthus leaves over band shading from yellow to brown.

title: Butter Plate
media: molded earthenware, underglaze and overglaze decoration
description: Molded basket pattern, with relief kerchief and morning glory, in blue and green.

title: Drawing
media: brush and gouache on cream paper, mounted on cream paper
description: Left side, green maze-like pattern with red circles on black ground; right side, vertical band, purple cloud band surrounds curving lines in red, yellow and black on black ground.

title: Purse (England)
description: Rectangular purse, solidly beaded. Against a background of opalescent beads are pictured Masonic emblems, with a border of blue checkerboard. Lined in white leather, on which is inscribed Miss Dearsley, 25 Dec. 1870.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Galizien (Galicia)
description: On teal blue ground, partial view of a pattern design with a church, dove, fence, and bushes, each element outlined in thick dark blue lines, accented with red, yellow, pink, purple, and green.

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Soana, 1920–25
description: Black ground with white rectilinear line pattern of squares, rectangles, and stylized blossoms

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Prolog (Prologue)
description: Pale green ground with dark green vertical stripes and blue vertical stripes with blocks of yellow, green, and blue.

title: Printing Block (USA)
description: One of twenty-one wood blocks showing a different floral motif formed by metal strips set in wood.

title: Print, Shimada, Travelers Crossing the Oigawa, in The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan Tsugi-no Uchi)
description: Here is a scene of travelers making their way from the east bank of the Oi River to the west bank. During heavy rains, travelers would have to wait until the river subsided. The hotels on either side would become very crowded. Once the water went down they could cross the river themselves or hire watermen to carry them or porters to float them across on a raft.

title: Drawing, Ceiling in Hadrian's Villa, near Tivoli
media: pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, gold paint, black chalk on paper
description: Design of a ceiling.  One quarter of the design is shown.  In the center is a tent cupola shown from below.  It is supported at four corners by bucrania and in the middle of the curved sides by winged female half-figures, who are on top of an arch which is supported by two satyr gaines.  In the center of the cupola is a panel with a sphere supported by four children.  A few grotesque motifs are in the remaining panels.  From the bucrania hang festoons, the other ends of which are held by women who stand near the geines.  Below the bucrania are sitting figures of gods; shown are Zeus and Ares.  Outside are framing panels of different shapes.

title: Border
media: block printed and flocked on continuous paper
description: Top and bottom borders with design imitating passementerie or drapery. Borders are printed on a striped sidewall paper. Printed in green flock and overprinted with brighter green, the top border is formed by intertwined lace or ribbon, forming sharp angles, with pendent tassels. Above this is a wider band of gimp or fancy ribbon. The bottom border is composed of the same lace or ribbon forming sharp diamond shapes. Within the diamond framework is a rosette. Between the diamond shapes is a patera within a rectangular framework. The sidewall is bands of stripes, alternating wide and narrow.

title: Textile, Hameau
description: Horizontal stripe with pattern of umbrellas (?) in dark blue, light blue, light gray, yellow and ivory.

title: Sidewall (Japan)
description: Imitation leather. Embossed foliate and floral design realistically interpreted. Printed in metallic gold on deep red.

title: Fragment
description: Border fragment with cutwork, embroidered scrolling floral forms and tiny insertions of reticella. Border of tiny buttonholed and picoted points.

title: Fragment
description: Fragment of Lille type bobbin lace, with tiny branches and quatrefoils.

title: Fragment, 18th century
description: Fragment of Lille style bobbin lace.

title: Textile (USA)
description: Small piece of blue fabric printed with with a black allover sprig-like design. The reverse has a sticker with the Swedish opera singer Jenny Lind. She first came to the United States in 1850 at the invitation of the showman P. T. Barnum.

title: Painting, Seated Lady
media: brush and watercolor on rice paper
description: A seated lady of quality, facing half-right, wearing long beads and an elaborately embroidered robe.

title: Bandbox And Lid, Port of Buffalo on Lake Erie
media: block-printed on handmade paper, pasteboard support
description: Hunting scene with men, horses and dogs, on bottom sides. On lid, terrace overlooking a river, on which is a steamboat. The lid is the Port of Buffalo. Printed in dark green, yellow and white on dark blue field.

title: Fringe (Italy)
description: Fringe with a red and blue checkerboard heading. Red and blue skirt threads arranged to form stripes.

title: Cooling Pail (France)
description: Cylindrical with slight flare at base and slight thickening at top. Ribbed sides and horizontal twisted handles. Decorated with lambrequin-like clusters of flowers and leaves at top and bottom, and square foliate medallions about center. Surface somewhat pitted.

title: Fragment (China), 19th century
description: Allover geometrical design in rose and blue on light blue ground.

title: Pleated Fan
media: painted parchment leaf backed with painted paper, incised and pierced mother-of-pearl sticks with applied metallic foil, glass stone at the rivet
description: Pleated fan. Leaf of painted parchment backed with painted paper; sticks of incised and pierced mother-of-pearl with applied metallic foil; glass stone at the rivet. The figures in the central frame are after a painting by Jean Baptiste Joseph Pater (1695-1736) entitled, "Conversation Galante dans un Parc." The partially visible pen and ink drawing on the left is signed Perelle and is probably a copy of a countryside view by the painter and engraver, Gabriel Perelle (1603-77). Scattered framed pictures and the twisting ribbon motif create a trompe l'oeil effect.

title: Sidewall And Borders (France)
description: Vertical rectangle. Woman in a red-skirted dress, feeding chickens. Across the bottom is a border of butterflies; across the top a border of festooned flowers and foliage; above this, and along the two sides, a border of simulated cyma reversa molding.

title: Border (France)
description: Pink and blue flowers alternating with grisaille acanthus scrolls. A row of strung beads is below.

title: Ceiling Border (USA)
description: Quarter sections of a ceiling motif, forming flattened circle of lotus border, and conventionalized flower in corners. Printed in blue and three browns on ochre. "a" with two pairs of facing sections; "b" with one pair.

title: Franco-British Exhibition Matchsafe
description: Rectangular, lid curved, featuring red, white and blue enameled decoration, gold oval framed portraits of Britain's King Edward VII on left and France's President Armand Fallières on right, the French and British flags above them, their names inscribed on flowing banners beneath, inscribed below "Souvenir, Franco-British Exhibition, 1908." Reverse features advertisement, inscribed "Muratti's Ariston Cigarettes, Smoked All Over The World." Side panel inscribed "B. Muratti Sons & Co. Ltd." Opposite side panel inscribed "Manchester, London, Berlin, & Co. Ltd." Lid hinged on upper left. Striker on bottom.

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: Diamond trellis design with inset floral motif. b) Deep blue oval at grid intersections, with connecting rope twist or cable molding. Printed in blue, white and possibly black on ungrounded tan paper. a) is a much smaller piece of the same design, printed in gray with green ovals.

title: Sampler (Italy)
description: Design of vase with flowers.

title: Drawing, Costume Design: Queen's Servant

description: Figure facing left wearing Turkish-style costume with bright blue and white turban, blue trousers with gold circles pattern, and white sash, designed for the servant of the queen in the third act of Pisanella: La Morte Parfumee.

title: Print, Lion's Dance (Shishi-odori), No. 2

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Treff, 1910–32

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Limanova

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Kardinal

title: Wall Facing (Holland)

Two vertical rectangles, twenty-three tiles high.  A) Nine tiles wide at top; seven tiles wide at bottom.  B) Ten and one-half tiles wide.  

Arabesque design of foliage.  A) with centered figure of Justice under a canopy.  B) with centered urn.

title: Bandbox And Lid, Sandy Hook

title: Print, Firefly of Ugi (Uji no Hotaru), No. 37

title: Border

title: Tile (England)

title: Plate (Netherlands)

title: Print, The Fighting Bear (Kuma Funjin), No. 12

title: Sampler (Italy)
media: linen, colored glass beads, metallic thread
description: Linen panel embroidered with colored glass beads showing vase with flowers between two trees. Geoometric bands beneath the vase and triangular points in blue and red above. Thin blue border and trimmed in silver bobbin lace.

title: Sidewall (USA)

title: Drawing
media: brush and gouache on cream paper, mounted on cream paper
description: Vertical symmetrical band with three straight bands and four curved ones. The straight bands consist of stylized geometric shapes on peach ground. Two cloud bands in green flank central section, and then flanked by cobalt blue geometric lines with green rhomboids.

title: Sidewall (USA)
description: On gray ground, vertical rinceaux with motifs of flowers surrounded by mosaic frames, with hanging garland.

title: Pendant (England)

title: Drawing, Textile Design: Quadern (Ashlars)
media: brush and gouache, graphite on paper
description: Repeating diamond shapes with leaf motif in middle and green and orange flower in between on blue toned background.

title: Textile, Karst
description: Pattern incomplete. Stylized landscape with trees and birds in light purple, blue, green, brown, pink, black and white.

title: Scenic, El Dorado

title: Album, Designs for Souvenir Fans for the 1867 Paris Exposition Universelle
media: transparent watercolor and white gouache, graphite indicating fan shape on white wove paper
description:
Fan design consisting of 3 images:
At left: Classical bust, right profile of a woman, terracotta ground, octagonal shape
Center: Dancing young Bacchus holding a tambourine in left hand and a spear in right hand on green ground, twig and leaf border encircled by blue ribbon, bows at either side, circular shape. Inscribed on ribbon, bottom center, pen and black ink, À Paris Exposition Universel de 1867
At right: classical bust, left profile of a woman, terracotta ground, octagonal shape

title: Bedcover (England)
description: Large quilted bedcover of cream-white cotton plate printed in blue. Design shows a landscape; in the foreground, at left, under a cluster of trees, a man plays a pipe while another leans on a long stick, listening. In front of these two figures are grazing cattle and sheep. Behind the two men, on a road, a man and a woman leading a small boy pass by. Farther down the road is a man with a basket on his head. Beyond the fence on the side of the road is a park with a deer and an orchard. In the far background are two large houses with tall pines behind them. Bedcover is edged with a narrow printed border and is lined with plain white cotton and interlined. Quilting is in a simple zigzag pattern.

title: Sample Book, Wallpapers of Merit, Book No. 3
description: Consists of 95 sidewalls and 73 borders. Gold embossed title on black paper cover. Papers consist of imitations of textures and woods, floral borders, stripes, large over-all patterns

description:
One of seven pages from a printed fabric sample book.
Page is double-sided

title: Drawing, Cloudy Sky over Mountains; Verso: Elevation of a Monument
Border (France)

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Two vertical rectangles of joined sheets of paper, with one similar and one identical unit of decoration. In the bottom half of each, a pink and green rose wreath, enclosing a diagonally set square in which is a lyre; a palmette at each corner, outside the wreath. In the upper half, a Pompeian framework composed of urns, hanging musical instruments and drapery swags, enclosing grisaille figure groups: a) woman with lyre, attended by putto; b) woman putting a wreath upon a bust of Voltaire, attended by a putto.

title: Button (France)
description:
Circular button of bronze with central ornament of pearl shell carved to represent flowers with rhinestone center.

On card 28

title: Print, Head and shoulders of a w
Playing Card, Minchiate (Tarot) Playing Card
description: Part of a set of Italian Minchiate playing cards.

title: Drawing, Elevation of Salon Chimney Wall
media: pen and black and brown ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache, over black chalk indications on paper, lined
description: Elevation of a wall.  The center of the design is a chimney with a large mirror above. At the base of the mirror, standing on the mantel, are two statues of a child on a cloud, holding a torch.  The mirror is flanked by composite columns with which pilasters on either side of the doorway correspond.  Between the columns and the pilasters are two female statues.  There is a door opening on either side, at the edges of the sheet.   Above the doors, in arched over doors, are reliefs of seated figures among trophies of arms.   An entablature separates this section of the wall from an attic.  In the attic, at the center, two winged statues with trumpets open a curtain.  Decorative panels on either side of this grouping show figures with large oval mirrors/medallions.

title: Print, Ornamental Design from Nouvelle suite de cahiers chinois a l'usage des dessinateurs et des peintres No.3, (New Suite of Chinese Ornament for the Use of Designers and Painters)

description: Fantasy three-level Chinoiserie bridge floating in empty space.  Chinois figure in pointed hat sits on steps in lower center, above him three bridges leading to arched doorways.  Architecture elements surrounded by foliage and trees.

title: Print, Ornamental Design from "Nouvelle suite de cahiers chinois a l'usage des dessinateurs et des peintres" No.3, Inventes et dessines par Jean Pillement. Graves par Anne Allen.

title: Print, Design for a Niche With a Painting

title: Drawing, Bedroom of King Pedro IV of Portugal (Emperor  Dom Pedro I of Brazil), Palace of Queluz
media: brush and watercolor, graphite, gum arabic on white wove paper
description: The palace was built in 1747-1752 in Portugal by Mateus Vicente de Oliveira (1706-1786) for the Infante Dom Pedro in homage to Versailles.  The bedroom of the Emperor Dom Pedro I of Brazil (the King's Bedroom) represents a remarkable example of Rococo decoration.  The circular room is decorated by Manoel da Costa with episodes from the story of Don Quixote. Da Costa was influenced by the French Rococo designer, Jean Pillement.  A rendering of Apollo and the Muses is partially seen on the ceiling.  The bed is draped in the French style; however, the rest of the furniture appears to be English.  The radiating patterned floor is probably of Brazilian hardwood.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Wall Facing (Netherlands)
description: Running design for a frieze or a dado, composed of scrolls of foliage and strapwork, and four repeating motifs--a seated woman in a small upright oval medallion, a putto seated on a rocailled base, and strapwork in axial pattern.  The various panels, A to F, show various repeats of the same design, all being five tiles high and a varying number of tiles wide.

title: Print, Plate 9 (recto) and plate 10 (verso), Description of the Celebrations Given by the City of Strasbourg, from the series Fêtes de Strasbourg
description:
Plate 9 (recto) within rocaille border: 25 lines of text, “de Klinglin Préteur Royal en habit d’écarlate galonné avec autant… Le Roi entra ensuite dans la Ville au bruit de toutes les Cloches es…”

Plate 10 (verso) within rocaille border topped by a cartouche with the cipher of Louis XV: 25 lines of text, “de l’Artillerie des Ramparts… Aux deux cotés de la Statue étoient deux Anges appuyés sur les…”

title: Tile (USA)
description: Square, molded tile of white clay; reverse bears inscription in double line frame: "J. & J.G. Low/ Patent Art Tile Works/ Chelsea, Mass. U.S.A. / copyright 1881 by J & J.G. Low". Face of tile is decorated with four petalled flower placed so that petals extend into corners; painted dark, green crackle glaze.

title: Knife (Netherlands), ca. 1730
description: Blade has straight lower edge, upper edge tapering towards the blunt point. Plain bolster, tapering handle, oval in section, repousse floral decoration on front and back.

title: Drawing, Design for a Milk Pitcher
media: brush and watercolor, gold gouache, graphite on cream paper
description: Design for a tall milk pitcher with partial handle; spout and lid in graphite. Body decorated with vertical alternating stripes; one with gold roses on vines against light yellow ground and the other with pink roses on white ground.

title: Book Illustration, Designs of Chinese Buildings, Furniture, Dresses, Machines, and Utensils; Pagoda design
Book Illustration, Specimens of Ornamental Art, Selected from the Best Models of the Classical Epochs; Painted Details of the Lower Church of St. Francis of Assisi
Four Continents Plaque
description:
All relief plaques rectangular with domed tops and projections to the side, probably made to fit into a specific framework or piece of furniture.
(a) Asia seated holding a gadrooned lamp in one hand and a leafy branch in the other, a camel's head coming in on the left; (b) Europe, seated holding a cornucopia of fruit and wheat above a helmet, on one side, the other arm around a tempietto a horse's head above, and with bishop's mitre in front and with ewer and basin below,  and below her feet, a classical bust on books, a palette and brushes above a recorder or flute; (c) Africa-female African seated figure, her tightly curled hair in close cropped cap, one hand raised holding a crab, the other resting on a lion, a palm tree in the crook of her arm; (d) America, a Native American seated in feather skirt and with feather headdress, bare chested and barefoot, a rugged landscape with tree to one side, holding a parrot out on his hand above an alligator under his foot on the other.

title: Fragment
description: Incomplete design of foliage and flowers in blue, yellow, green brown and red.

title: Fragment
description: Animals, birds and plant forms in brown/purple on yellow. Selvage with green and white edge at left.

title: Fragment
description: Fragment of Lille type bobbin lace

title: Miser's Purse (USA)
description: Knitted miser's purse in green, pink, brown and white, with steel rings and bell-shaped ornaments at each end.

title: Drawing, Design for a printed fabric

title: Drawing, Design for a woven fabric
media: graphite, brush and gouache on cream paper
description: Rising, broadly waved rose stem and two parts of another are shown.

title: Pleated Fan

description: Fan with carved and pierced mother-of-pearl sticks, and gilded leaf  with lithograph promenade scene. On sticks: central cartouche of a lady and a gentleman playing the fife.

title: Drawing, Burned Trees and Houses
media: graphite on wove paper, laid down
description: Horizontal slight sketch, probably of burned trees and houses.

title: Handle
description: Pendant handle

title: Drawing, Design for an Embroidered or Woven Horizontal Border
media: brush and light blue, white gouache on glazed tracing paper
description: Plants with fan-like blossoms stand over two undulating strips.

title: Drawing, Design for an Earring
media: pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper
description: The ring has two slopes. On the larger, a disk is fastened, intended to be enameled like the drop and the drapery. The disk and the drop are framed by a row of beads. Both are connected by a floral motif and a drapery festoon.

title: Fragment
description: Applique of leaf pattern in gold-faced fabric on previously stamped red velvet.

title: Mount
description: chariot

title: Mount
description: urn

title: Fringe (Spain)
description: Fringe with a blue, red, green, yellow and white striped heading. Skirt threads, looped and twisted, are arranged to form stripes.

title: Print, Almanac for 1789
media: engraving, brush and watercolor on paper
description: Calendar for first half-year, with three scènes galants; a promenade, fishing, country life.

title: Print, Title page, "Fêtes de Strasbourg"
description: Rocaille cartouche with the royal coat of arms at the top, musical trophies at the sides, and a trophy of arms at the bottom. In central compartment: REPRESENTATION / DES FETES DONNES / PAR / LA VILLE STRASBOURG / Pour la Convalescence du Roi; à l’arrive et / pendant le séjour de Sa Majesté en cette Ville. / Inventé, Dessiné, et dirigé par J.M. Weis, Graveur de la Ville de Strasbourg

title: Print, Design for a Cartouche Representing the Country of China
description: Cartouche composed of a shell in reverse. Perched atop the shell, a Chinese woman holding a paddle and a Chinese man framed by animal horns and holding a long-handled pipe. A bow and arrow at right. The arrangement humorously refers to a lumbering, slow-moving "dromedary," or the lack of progress of China in comparison to France.

title: Mount
description: foliage

title: Heur et Malheur (Happiness and Woe) Token
description: Octagonal gambling token. Obverse shows the double bust of young Janus. Inscription: HEUR ET MALHEUR (happiness and woe) / GAYRARD-F. Reverse shows military trophies.

title: Frieze (England)
description: Advancing wave motif at top and bottom. Narrow green bands along either edge. Printed in green on pale green field.

title: Drawing, One of Sixteen Scenes of the Death and Burial of a Man
media: japan watercolor on silk or paper
description: From a series of sixteen scenes of the death and burial of a man in Japan.

title: Photograph, Photograph of Apartment Building Designed by Hector Guimard (No. 3)
description: Photograph of one of the apartment buildings designed by Hector Guimard, belonging to a series of photographs documenting his architecture.

title: Print, The Dream of the Doctor
description: A man seated before a stove, sleeping, his head resting against cushions. He faces left, his head shown almost in profile. In the foreground, right, stands a nude woman (Venus), her figure turned slightly to the left, her head in the direction of the dreamer, her right arm extended toward him. A demon appears behind the sleeping man, about to blow a bellows in his ear. A winged Amor, lower left, attempts to mount stilts.

title: Miser's Purse (France)
description: Tightly crocheted dark green silk ornamented with cut steel beads in small geometric pattern.   Two steel rings at closing; at one end, a fringe of steel beads; small faceted drop and tassel at the other.

title: Collar (Spain)
description: Deep collar with two rows of flower head halves that form a scalloped egde.

title: Miser's Purse (France)
description: Crocheted miser's purse of pink silk with pattern and tassels of steel beads.

title: Miser's Purse (possibly USA)
media: silk, glass beads, metal, metallic thread
description: Miser's purse crocheted of green silk and ornamented with china, glass and steel beads and a silk tassel.  Fitted with two steel rings.

title: Headcovering (mezzaro) (Italy)
description: Mezzaro in a multicolored design on a white ground. Central large-scale tree with many different blossoms. Small flanking tree on either side. Floral sprays, insects, birds, and animals scattered over the ground. Border of massed flowers and fruit with perching brids. Urns and vases in foreground.

title: Sidewall (France)
description: Diagonally repeating design of four elements, in a framework of foliage: a) horseman, with castles in background; b) drinkers; c) hunters; d) herdsmen, with sheep and cows. Coloring scheme high in key. Vertical rectangle.

title: Frieze (France)
media: block-printed and stenciled on machine-made paper
description: Cloister or open courtyard seen in deep perspective. Grisaille arcade and portical, with figures in sixteenth century costume. Landscape seen in distance through colonnade. Brush strokes are evident in some of the pigments. Sky is shaded from orange-pink up to blue. Horizontal rectangle.

title: Tile (Spain)
description: White, green, light brown and dark brown glazes, in cuerda seca technique. Geometrical design, called Laceria (lacework). Hispano-Moresque style.

title: Button (France)
description:
Flat circular button with shanks, varying. -a: engraved pearl and steel beads arranged in rings; -b: flower with petals of colored steel; -c: pearl and colored steel in rings; -d,h: smoked pearl and cut steel; -f,g,j,m: engraved pearl centers on disc of steel; -e,k,l,n: ornamented steel centers on pearl discs; -i: pearl shell, colored yellow, and set in steel rim. 

Components -a/-c,-e/-g/-j,-k,-m,-n are on card 31

title: Print, Recueil D'Architecture Civile...
description:

Architecture & floorplans, Gardens & garden architecture.

title: Print, Frieze: Trophies of Arms and Putti
